  • Ensures that observed patterns of customer pain-points are highlighted to manager

  • Informs customers of the appropriate support options that best fit the customer's needs

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use software. (And that’s what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually use). A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here’s your opportunity. We’re hiring engineers who are passionate about technology and education. The product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. Most of our work is open source, even our primary product. We are also changing how teachers and students interact, whether in small groups or with tens of thousands of students in one course. Check out our online courses on Canvas Network. So…if you like front-end development, back-end development, or some combination of these, let's talk. There are lots of interesting, complex, and challenging problems that will leverage your skills; oh, and new things come up every day. There will be a technical interview with lots of white board action (but no silly puzzles or trick questions). We may even have you code up a simple app to demonstrate your abilities.


Join us at our downtown Chicago office. Address: 1 Prudential Plaza, 130 E. Randolph St. Suite 1800, Chicago, IL 60601


Remote option is only available for US authorized workers who currently reside in the US with proven success in working remotely.

jobs.title: Backend Developer - Node.js
jobs.content: Help our team develop mobile advertising and big data services. The position involves developing highly-scalable, global mobile advertising services using modern technology such as node.js, redis, mongo, aws, and REACT all hosted in AWS.

jobs.title: Engineer (SDKs & Samples)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Seattle, WA
URL: https://auth0.com/jobs

Are you passionate about building tools that help other developers be more productive? Auth0 is looking for SDK engineers to help drive the end-to-end developer experience for various languages and platforms. This is more than just writing code, this is about making sure everyone who uses Auth0 has an amazing experience.

We are looking for somebody who can balance technical requirements, customer needs, and data to constantly drive improvement. In any given day you might handle anything from adding new functionality to an SDK, creating a sample, writing technical documentation, or even jumping in and helping a customer solve a really tough problem. You will be the go to person for a particular language/framework at Auth0.

The areas you will focus on are:
  • Creating and maintain our core SDKs. This will include anything from adding new features, updating when new versions of frameworks are released, to fixing bugs reported by customers. You will be responsible for the quality and completeness of the SDKs you oversee.
  • Write end-to-end documentation for your language/framework. At Auth0 we believe that if the customer can't figure out an answer then we need to do better. Your job will be to always improve the docs to make the experience better for our customers. We want security to be easy, you will help make it so.
  • Create meaningful samples that show best practices using Auth0. We want it to be as simple as possible for a developer to go from nothing to having a fully functioning and secure app up and running. You will build samples to guide the way.

Attributes we care about:
  • Motivated - You are excited to build new software. It doesn’t matter if it is front-end, backend, tests, or even maybe a build script. You get it done and you do your job well. You like learning new skills and applying your existing skills to make things happen.
  • Completionist - You ship code. Getting a feature out to our customers today is better than getting it out tomorrow. You should drive to ship each and every day. You should have a history of shipping.
  • Detail Oriented - You’ll need to understand the big picture, but also be keenly aware of the details. When it comes to shipping SDKs and developer docs the details make or break the experience. A simple missing step or line of code can be the difference between a customer loving or leaving our product. You should be the type of person who cares deeply about the details.
  • Problem Solver - You can figure out a problem with little or no guidance. We hire explorers and doers. Given a problem you dive in and find the answer. When presented a challenge you immediately start to think of several solutions. You can't reset until you find the best answer.
  • Highly Technical - You will be the go to person on a particular technology. You are the authority. You need to understand the how and the why. In this role you will need to solve real-world problems, and as such you need to have experience building and shipping real products.

Technical Skills:
We are looking for people who have expertise with the following languages/frameworks. You will focus on one or two of these and should be able to go deep.

  • AngularJS, Angular 2
  • EmberJS, EmberJS 2
  • React, Redux, Fluxible
  • Node.JS, Express, Hapi
  • Java, Spring Security
  • Ruby, Ruby on Rails
  • Python
  • PHP, Laravel
  • iOS
  • Android
  • React Native
  • Ionic, Ionic 2

To apply: https://jobs.lever.co/auth0/c518c157-35ca-4f6b-88f1-ff49f1b3f03c/apply

jobs.title: Team Lead Software Development
jobs.content:
Part of eBay family, mobile.de is the #1 online vehicle marketplace in Germany. It is ranked among the top ten websites in Germany and we are proud that more than 90% of German dealers are also mobile.de customers. We are seeking a professional individual to join us in Berlin/Dreilinden as


Team Lead (m/f) Software Development


We work in small focused, collaborative project teams following an agile methodology. Cross functional teams including product management, product development, and UXD work on a daily basis to create successful products that have impact and help our customers. The Team Lead will have a breadth of experience with one or more of the following: Java, other JVM based languages, Javascript, frontend and mobile development and should be a strong coder. We believe that developers should write their own tests, so any Team Lead would also be accountable for testing discipline, and an advocate of great testing methods.


We work in self-managed teams, so the Team Lead needs to be comfortable playing the role of mentor to both junior and senior engineers. The candidate will be proficient in teaching and leading by example. They also need to be very comfortable with being able to line manage, sometimes very senior engineers, and with helping people grow their careers and ambitions at all levels.


You will:




  • Lead, coach and mentor a cross-functional team of 5 engineers




  • Support recruiting of new team members (screening candidates, conducting interviews)




  • Support agile development and continuous delivery in the team




  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to Product Owners, UX, other Team Leads and engineers




  • Foster continuous knowledge transfer in the team and across teams




  • Ensure code quality and maintainability by improving build and test systems




  • Contribute to the team's work with backend or frontend coding (depending on your experience/preference)




Your profile:




  • Several years of experience in software development (backend or frontend development)




  • Passion for beautiful, high quality code with an eye for simplicity and pragmatism




  • Experience in leading projects and cross-functional teams




  • University degree or equivalent educational background




  • Passion for agile software development and solving problems together with a team




  • Strong communication skills in English (German is a big plus)




  • DevOps mindset and willingness to learn new things questioning the status quo




What we offer:




  • A competitive salary, flexible working hours, great benefits and an excellent working environment




  • Potential for career advancement in just about any line of business and the opportunities to work almost anywhere in the world within eBay Inc.






  • Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce, professionalism and a good sense of humor




  • Silicon Valley Amenities (iPhones and MacBooks, Ping-pong and kicker tables, volleyball and basketball courts, free coffee and juice, tasty subsidized lunches, a nice forest for walking and thinking and a free on-campus gym with trainers)

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm with a focus on technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of the markets. We are a global liquidity provider and market maker, operating around the clock and around the globe, employing over 400 people in our offices in New York, London and Hong Kong.



The markets change rapidly, and we need to change faster still. Every day, we come to work with new problems to solve, new systems to build, and new theories to test. Technology is at the core of how we approach that work and developers are intimately tied in to every area of the business.



We are big believers in functional programming, using OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language.  We also believe  in the value of open source software, using it in our daily work and releasing hundreds of thousands of lines of our own code as open source.

jobs.title: DevOps & Systems Administration
jobs.content:
Linux Administrators work with our in-house trading systems and critical infrastructure. Our mix of custom-designed and open source systems allow you to dive to the real source of a problem without having to play guessing games with a vendor. Members of this group are hard-working systems engineers, administrators and programmers, tasked with maintaining, improving, and sometimes transforming our core technology infrastructure. We try to automate much of our work, and not because we are lazy. Deployment automation, centralization of management, and obsessive monitoring are the focus of many of our ongoing projects. We find that automation reduces our error rate and overall workload - plus, we think it's fun


You will be involved with monitoring and supporting the technical and operational stability of the firm's proprietary trading systems. Carrying out trade-support duties by working directly with the trading desks, technology departments and back-office departments to understand and react to issues as they arise during the trading day. The ability to identify and direct accurate and timely information to the firm's trading desks is of the utmost importance during the resolution of an issue. This requirement is achieved by trade-support with the use of the applications maintained and developed within the group.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - US Citizen Required - DoD Clearance
jobs.content:
Strategic Business Systems, Inc. is the PRIME on a government contract here in the Washington DC Metro are and we are looking to add a Senior Software Engineer to our team. An ACTIVE Top Secret is required for the position. (will be processed for a CI Poly)

***Possibility of working remote periodically***

Description:

The ideal candidate will have a Top Secret clearance, 5+ years of experience with full life-cycle software development (analysis, design, development, test, deployment, maintenance). Use of industry-proven design patterns and open source tools is encouraged. This position requires a combination of new application development tasks and enhancements to existing capabilities on a small team in an agile development environment.

Duties and Responsibilities:

The candidate will provide software design and development expertise in support of both new application development tasks and maintenance of the existing system. Candidates must be self-motivated individuals who can understand technical concepts and collaborate on technical direction with their development team.

jobs.title: Product Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Sortable automates ad operations for an ever-growing number of customers.


We’ve already passed the billions of impressions per month milestone. With more impressions comes more customers to support and more advertisers to integrate with.

We’re seeking a software engineer with strong interpersonal skills to head up our support engineering team. The ideal candidate will want to drive process improvements to ensure that all of our partners receive a top-notch integration experience.


In exchange, we provide a supportive team environment, opportunities for growth and competitive compensation.


What You’ll Do



  • Be the primary technical contact for our sales team

  • Be the front-line technical contact on integration phone calls with demand partners

  • Automate everything; build software tools to ensure we deliver excellent service to our customers

  • Have full support from the product engineering team to solve difficult issues

  • Investigate and triage integration problems during the publisher on-boarding process

  • Identify and implement process improvements and product changes


Who You Are



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Software Engineering, or equivalent practical experience

  • Experienced building modern websites, with an emphasis on front-end skills like HTML, JavaScript and CSS

  • Familiar with SQL, and open to learning more on the job. Digging into the data doesn’t daunt you

  • Assertive, yet collaborative: you’ll be working across many disciplines and with internal and external stakeholders

  • Organized and methodical: you’re not happy only solving the immediate problem, you want to ensure the root cause is diagnosed and remedied or documented


Bonus Points



  • Previous work experience in a client-facing role

  • Previous experience with DFP, DFA, OpenX, or other ad-serving platforms

  • You’ve used Greasemonkey / Tampermonkey and are comfortable writing a user script

  • Your bookshelf includes books by Steve Souders or Ilya Grigorik

  • You’ve tinkered with PhantomJS, Selenium, WebPageTest or other browser automation tools in the past

  • Your browser’s address bar autocompletes “js” to “jsfiddle.net”


How to Apply


There are two ways to apply:



  1. Complete our coding challenge!

  2. Skip the challenge*, and just send your resume to jobs@sortable.com


* – Candidates who submit a coding challenge solution with their resume will be moved to the top of the pile and, if selected, will have a streamlined interview process.


Good Luck!


The Sortable Hiring Team

Wallaby Financial is seeking a Quality Assurance Engineer to test products across our mobile, web, and internal product suite. jobs.title: Back End Software Developer
jobs.content:
The Literacy Design Collaborative (LDC) is hiring a Software Developer to scale web based literacy tools that help teachers develop skills to help their students master literacy skills. In this role, you will be designing and developing cross-enterprise tools and services. You will be responsible for understanding teacher needs and developing tools that help improve literacy instruction primarily in 6th through 12th grade language arts, science and social studies classes.



Our team is looking for a Web Developer with the knowledge and skills to build highly interactive software interfaces and interoperable solutions.  You should be a  talented and experienced back-end developer with expertise in creating APIs for interactive web based applications.  You should have a solid background and understanding of best practices in the fundamentals of software development. You should enjoy adding value to a very talented team that includes a designer, developers, expert teachers, and business partners.  You should be passionate about building teacher friendly, engaging websites and highly scalable distributed systems.

jobs.title: Salesforce Project Manager - To $130,000
jobs.content:
Technical Project Manager


To $130,000



Streaming Music Royalties


Salesforce Applications


Music industry's performance rights organization responsible for collecting and distributing royalties for sound recordings played on Satellite Radio, Internet radio, and similar platforms is experiencing rapid growth and seeks an experienced Technical Project Manager that excels in a dynamic, fast-moving, and agile environment.


This client is rapidly growing and is currently transforming its business and technology platform. To ensure that those efforts succeed and to support future growth, they are expanding a top notch technology team. This role requires an energetic IT Project Manager with a successful track record, ideally with experience in and passion for the Agile approach. The ideal candidate will have a strong tech background, excellent communication skills (both oral and written), and be a team player. Project Managers (PMs) wear many hats and are hands-on technologists. In addition to the typical project overview role, PMs perform requirements gathering and quality assurance (testing) activities as required.



The PM will work closely with the tech and business teams to help surface requirements and eliminate roadblocks, and to communicate all issues among all stakeholders. On integration or non-development efforts, the PM will manage schedule, budget, and communication. The PM will ensure that development policies and standards are followed. The ideal candidate will be familiar with Agile and traditional project management methodologies and practices.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage one or more IT projects concurrently;



  • Continuously improve methodologies, processes, and standards;

  • Assist in establishing and adhering to budgets, schedules, work plans and quality requirements;

  • Interface with and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders in senior management, business operations, software engineering, IT operations, finance, and other areas to ensure high quality delivery of software projects on time and budget;

  • Provide input during the determination of the company technology strategy and roadmap;

  • Gather and document requirements, and perform the necessary analysis to support requirements gathering. Ideally, candidate will be comfortable with SQL and a scripting language for those instances when executing that analysis requires the use of such tools;

  • Perform manual testing of software applications.



Skills and Qualifications:




    • Experience using JIRA as a project management tool;

    • At least 2 years experience as a Salesforce Administrator;

    • Some SOQL chops and strong familiarity with Salesforce architecture and configuration capabilities;

    • Experience integrating Salesforce with other systems (using techniques such as iFrames and REST web services);

    • SQL chops, too, and ability to query SQL databases;

    • Comfort in some scripting language;

    • Ability to read and understand APEX, Java, and JavaScript code.



Reports to the Director of Projects Management.


This unique company is the only firm in the United States performing this service for the music industry and consequently is very stable.  It is an exhilarating environment with broad and deep technical challenges and offers exposure to a business environment and culture that is unique in the metro area.  The office in DC has convenient access by Metro.


BetaTech, Inc.


Email: pkennedy@betatechinc.com


(301) 942-7840

jobs.title: Director of Quality Assurance
jobs.content:
We are hiring a Director of Quality Assurance (m/f)


We have a fantastic opportunity for a Director of QA to join us to lead and grow our agile QA teams to meet the ever demanding analytics needs of Home24. We’re a two sided technology company with demands to test both our internal enterprise systems that run our business and our internet platform including web shop and native applications. Both need to joined up for us to be successful. We’re looking for a natural leader who can align our approach to testing across our business.


By selecting leading testing technologies you’ll guide your team to adopt best industry practices and implement a modern test strategy. You’ll lead by example, inspire and develop a team of talented test engineers to achieve their potential delivering high quality solutions to help Home24 deliver exceptional quality world class solutions. This position is full-time and based in our great office in Berlin

Responsibilities



  • Define and implement a blended automated and manual test strategy for both internet and enterprise solutions

  • Build a QA team of professionals with appropriate skills, attitudes and motivation

  • Lead and develop the team of talented test engineers to reach their true potential

  • Work closely with Engineering, Product and Enterprise leadership to drive our test strategy

  • Set clear goals and create a great work environment based on ownership, accountability and trust, in collaboration with the engineering and management teams

  • Advocate and introduce modern software development practices (CI/CD, test automation etc.)

  • Champion test engineering and operational excellence, establishing metrics and processes for continuous assessment and improvement


What we offer you



  • Opportunity to work with great inspiring people

  • Benefits as employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and more

  • Skill-dependent, negotiable salary – don’t hesitate to approach us


If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, get in touch. Send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, etc.), a code sample as well as your expected salary and possible start date.

jobs.title: Lead Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Overview:
hatch is currently working with an exciting VC funded energy analytics startup, Aquicore, headquartered in our nation’s capital (Northwest, DC), founded in 2013.  Aquicore is looking to build out their innovative platform that offers energy analytics and automation solutions for commercial real-estate customers.  They just received a 'Series A' round of funding to help them build out their engineering team and are targeting a Lead Full-Stack Engineer interested in greenfield development. You would be primarily responsible for developing the back-end architecture (Java/Scala/Play) of their software, this allows customers to collect/analyze millions of points of data from live sensors in their commercial buildings.  You would also be looked at to help across the entire platform.  The team currently consists of 5 other engineers that also work across the full-stack (Bootstrap/Angular/Java/Scala/Play/AWS) and you would be looked at to help mentor the junior engineers in this role, while taking the company to new heights.


Does This Describe You?



  • Love developing clean code with cutting-edge technologies (Scala & Play)

  • Working with API’s & Open-Source Software excites you

  • Working with a true tech startup gets your entrepreneurial juices flowing

  • You’re passionate about clean-energy and playing a part in protecting our earth


If you are interested in learning more about this company or any Startups/Small Businesses in the area, please contact us!! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Why contract at Hays?

Hays is the UK's leading technology recruiter that places thousands of contractors into some of the most exciting assignments across the sector. We have been recognised by users of contractoruk.com as the 'best recruitment agency to contract with' for three consecutive years.

Our recruiting experts are vastly knowledgeable and focused on specific skill-sets, allowing us to better understand the needs of our clients. This insight is then transferred into helping our candidates, placing you in the best position when applying for contract developer jobs.

With an extensive network of specialist offices across the UK, we pay our contractors weekly and have an unrivalled range of contract developer opportunities available.

You will be working as a consultant, hired by Hayes at a large blue chip organisation working within the insurance sector as a DevOps Engineer in the digital engineering team within the digital part of the organisation.

Your responsibilities will include the implementation and management of continuous delivery systems and methodologies along with supporting applications and defining and deploying monitoring systems on AWS.

In order to meet the strategic requirements of the business you will need to contribute to the development of solutions, applications and identify improvement opportunities.

What you'll need to succeed

Professional experience of Linux, Puppet and Amazon Web Services will put you in a great position to succeed in this contract opportunity along with having experience of working within a scrum and agile environment.

The role will see you developing high quality web applications so knowledge of C# MVC, HTML5 and JavaScript are required.

What you'll get in return

A daily rate of £450 per day and all the tools to help you get the job done to the best of your ability.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

Hays EA is a trading division of Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited and acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Fugue is helping shape the future of Cloud Computing. Fugue builds, optimizes, and enforces cloud infrastructure—continuously and automatically. We’re looking for a senior software engineer to join our automation team.


You will build and deploy the internal tools responsible for validating, analyzing, and gathering metrics on our core product and surrounding web services. You will also be mixing reliable industry standards, techniques, and algorithms with a generous dose of your own creativity to pioneer the new solutions in automation and instrumentation that are required to validate sophisticated, distributed (and often eventually consistent) processes and services. We are looking for highly motivated team members who face challenges head-on and are able to work in an innovative, complex, and dynamic environment.

jobs.title: Team Lead
jobs.content:
27partners is a multi award-winning technology company based in Soho, London. We engage communities through video and supporting applications, and bring the online experience our clients get at home into their business.


We are looking for a Senior PHP/JavaScript Developer to lead our growing development team. You will work closely with our customers, project managers, architects and systems engineers and have overall responsibility for the delivery of the development aspect of all of our digital projects. This is a fantastic opportunity to really make your mark in a vibrant, energetic business and work with some of the world's biggest brands.

jobs.title: Developer - C# ASP.NET MVC Opportunities
jobs.content:
reed.co.uk is looking for the world’s best developers to help the world Love Mondays.


The role


You will be joining a Scrum team responsible for helping our 4 million monthly visitors apply to over 250,000 jobs a day. Rewarding? Meaningful? You bet - we change people’s lives and develop their careers.


As a C# Developer, you will be involved in the full development lifecycle, from design through to implementation, and is an ideal opportunity to learn and use a wide range of cutting-edge technologies.


You'll be joining one of several cross-disciplinary teams, observing the agile Scrum methodology and working closely with other developers, DBA's, Front-end (HTML/CSS) experts, Scrum Masters, Product Owners and, just occasionally, with Marketing.


Technology


You'll have exposure to technology available on the Microsoft .NET platform including, C# 6, .NET 4.6, MVC 5, Web Api 2 plus some great open source software such as Lucene.NET, Redis, MiniProfiler, nHibernate, Dapper and Castle Windsor.


You'll have access to some great tooling support including Visual Studio 2015, Resharper 10,


DotTrace, LinqPad, NHProf. You’ll also use a nice, fast, shiny (gaming) PC with plenty of RAM, SSD and a decent GPU with a multi-monitor setup.


Benefits of working at reed.co.uk



  • 10% time dedicated to personal development

  • Two 'Hack days’ a year

  • Free Nespresso coffee and fruit

  • Flexible start and finish times

  • 25 days holiday with holiday exchange scheme

  • £500 per year on personal development allowance

  • Plus: Childcare vouchers, free eye tests, pension scheme, personal accident & critical illness cover

jobs.title: Software Engineer - NLP & ML
jobs.content:
Help us scale our AWS platform and get to work on cutting edge NLP and ML projects as we work on RTB solutions.


You will be joining an award winning early stage venture, where candidates will be working in an agile environment, pair programming and employing test driven development. We work with short iterations and deliver continuously, so we automate everything.  


This role is ideal for individuals who are ready to take the next step in their engineering career. Candidates will be expected to continue their professional development as an engineer, learning as they support senior software engineers and the CTO in the development of graduate software engineers and in delivering the technical and product roadmap.


We are based in South East London, near to London Bridge and Waterloo in a thriving community of like minded businesses.  The company is still small (less than 30 people), so everyone's contribution makes a difference.  


We offer a competitive salary and a good benefits package including share options after a qualifying period.  Candidates who do not have a valid visa to work in the UK, cannot be considered.

jobs.title: Mobile App developer- take Travel Expenses to the Next Level!
jobs.content: From the team that brought you TripIt, comes ExpenseIt. Capture receipts on the go and automatically pre-populate your expense line items—all without typing, hassle, or headaches. We’re proud of what we’ve accomplished so far, but we’re driven to take ExpenseIt to the next level. The Mobile Application Developer will help get us there. You are the type of Developer that is driven by keeping up to date and developing Mobile Apps (using technologies such as iOS and/or Android). You are also not afraid to tackle development challenges, and use your Agile knowledge for the good of projects! You will work alongside ExpenseIt’s Developers, Designers, Product Managers, and Quality Engineers. You will be responsible for providing Mobile Development expertise and support on relevant ExpenseIt components.

jobs.title: Experienced Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.


Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so experience in this language is required.


We believe that less is more and value simplicity above all else. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Rails and instead use smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.


We have also done projects in Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

jobs.title: DevOps - Infrastructure Support Specialist
jobs.content:

This is a DevOps intermediate experience and full time position.


You will:



  • Develop and maintain product infrastructure.

  • Manage Docebo software release roll-out.

  • Identify and maintain metrics that tell you how your software is performing.

  • Improve the deployment pipeline to ensure smooth and frequent releases.

jobs.title: Front-End Software Developer
jobs.content:
About Viewpost 


We’re a well-funded, unconventional startup poised to revolutionize the way businesses connect, invoice and pay one another. To make it possible, we've created a one-of-a-kind network that makes everyday business simple and fast. Why? Because we believe time is money. So if you value your time, consider devoting it to the excitement, camaraderie and experience of building something the business world has never seen—while also building your career.


Role Description 


Viewpost is seeking an exceptionally talented and motivated Front End Developer with mobile experience. This role will work daily with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React and Angular in order to create responsive applications for both the web and mobile devices.  Our team is flatly structured, so you won’t find any Junior or Senior titles here. We are all developers at various stages in our career, working together to solve a very difficult problem.  All opinions hold equal weight and can contribute towards the way we build our software.


What the Front-End Developer will do:



  • Use JavaScript, HTML and CSS to build out a large-scale, SPA-like web applications

  • Develop responsive applications for mobile devices daily

  • Work with various frameworks and libraries such as React and Angular, along with others, in order to build rich user experiences

  • Contribute to our front-end architecture as it continues to grow and evolve

  • This employee shall maintain or assist in the maintenance of the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all data in physical and/or electronic format

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
The technical team is a group of passionate technologists working to create the new generation of tools for the content ecosystem. We believe that technology should enable the business, not slow it down.


Our Stack:



  • Languages: Python, Go, Ruby/Rails, Ember.JS

  • Databases: Cassandra, Postgres, Redis, Solr, Vertica

  • Other: Spark, NSQ,  Chef



Senior Backend Engineer


SimpleReach is seeking an experienced backend engineer fluent in Python and big data.


Responsibilities:


You...



  • can look at applications holistically and understand the impact of changes throughout a system.

  • are comfortable including testing as part of your coding routine.

  • manage and maintain stream processing applications.

  • research and implement new technologies and design patterns to increase system efficiency.


You...



  • enjoy writing code in Python.

  • have experience working with and scaling some (or all) of the technologies in our stack.

  • are an excellent communicator with both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • value an environment that encourages people to be constantly learning.

  • enjoy working with large quantities of data and pushing the limits of technology.

jobs.title: Développeur Back-end et Front-end confirmé(e)
jobs.content:
Pour accompagner notre développement en France et à l'international, nous recherchons un(e) Développeur Back-end et Front-end confirmé(e).

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Amazon's eCommerce Services Group is looking for highly motivated web developers to join the Amazon Tax Software team to create new generation of user experience to manage the complexity of indirect tax rules & regulations across the globe. Work for the Tax Software team and get a chance to touch the full spectrum of Amazon technologies!

Web developers in eCSG tackle challenging problems in



  • Scalability: A lot of people shop here!

  • Robustness: If a core service goes down for a minute, so does the world's largest ecommerce site!

  • Latency: Load a page slowly, lose a customer!

  • Security: Customer trust is our most valuable asset!

  • Usability: A small improvement in usability at our scale means many more satisfied customers!


So if you want to stretch your web development muscles, power user experiences that drive customers to the world's largest ecommerce site, touch a wide spectrum of applications and features, and engage your entrepreneurial chops, come join our team!



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 3+ years professional experience in software or web development

  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, and problem solving

  • Proficiency with Java or an equivalent OO language

  • Proficiency using modern web development technologies and techniques, including HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Responsive Design, web services, etc.



  • Experience building large-scale web applications

  • 5+ years professional experience in software or web development

  • Experience developing AJAX interfaces with AJAX libraries and frameworks (e.g. ReactJS, JQuery, AngularJS, etc.)

  • Experience with MVC frameworks, Rails or Spring desired

  • Understanding of web services technologies such as REST, SOAP, HTTP, JSON

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment and to learn new frameworks/stacks

  • Strong customer focus, ownership, urgency, and drive

  • Passion for building a rich and innovative user experience

jobs.title: Full Stack PHP Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for a Web Developer to join our team in Vienna or St. Petersburg. Our new team member will work closely with our management team and with our tech team. You will be part of the API team of TourRadar and working closely with over 500 tour operators.


TourRadar works in a fast-paced environment where ideas are more than welcome. Creative minds that think out of the box will feel at home at TourRadar and experience a working environment of a true online travel Start-Up.


Responsibilities:

Based either at our office or on-site with a client, you'll work with the team to complete regular sprints, deploying builds daily, and using techniques such as TDD and pair programming to produce the best software possible. You'll take part in planning sessions, retrospectives and also join our daily morning standup to discuss the tasks at hand, the progress you've made, and any blockers you've encountered.


You can expect to work in a friendly environment that encourages learning and knowledge sharing; we have a team lunch together every Friday (usually a BBQ, rain or shine!), we hold weekly code dojos for anyone who can attend, and we have the occasional hack day where the entire team swarms on a particular task. We also encourage show and tells, where you're able to showcase new technologies you think we should be using, or breakthroughs you've made on the projects you've worked on.

jobs.title: Software Developer - Large Application Development
jobs.content:
Who are we?


Configura leads the industry in parametric software tools for automating, simplifying and accelerating the design, sales and order processes. We are a global company with customers in 10 countries and users in more than 50. We are headquartered in Linköping, Sweden, with two wholly owned subsidiaries in Grand Rapids, Mich., USA, and Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.


What do we need?


We are currently looking for skilled developers for our Grand Rapids location experienced with object-oriented programming and Java, C#, or C++ programming languages.  We develop in our own object-oriented programming language tailored to our specific needs. With this considered, we value programming skill over years of experience in a particular language or IDE.


If you love programming in an environment with new and challenging problems to solve, then Configura is the right place to apply!


We've told you a lot about us. Please, as part of your application, tell us a bit about you. We want to know why you would be a good fit and how you can help us!


Freeform adaption from Sun Tzu – The Art of War



  1. Programming is a matter of vital importance for mankind; the province of life or death; the road to survival or ruin. It is mandatory that it be thoroughly studied.

  2. Therefore, appraise it in terms of 5 fundamental factors and 7 golden rules.

  3. From the furnace of the mind of the skillful programmer, elemental thoughts emerge and are shaped and transformed through the precise language of programming, further feeding the furnace and shaping the flame. Programming is thus emotionally expressive as well as precise.

  4. Without focus and precision thoughts wander aimlessly and the program expressed is confused at best, cryptic, or even dis-informing.

  5. Programs are defined by 5 fundamental factors of algorithm, allocation, parallelism, exception handling, and optimization. Programs quickly overwhelm the mind. This must be countered through simplicity, abstraction, modularity, convention, practices, and speed.

  6. Know yourself and your code and in a hundred releases you will prevail. a. If you know yourself, but not your code, every other release will be in peril. b. If you do not know yourself, nor your code, every release will be in peril.

Database knowledge and experience.

Appreciation for visual design and its impact on user experience.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
As a front end developer at Triodos Bank, you are building the customer facing IT systems for one of the world’s leading sustainable banks. You are a member of a multidisciplinary development team, typically including a UX expert, an Agile test specialist, an information analyst and several peer developers. Your goal is to build great software for a middle sized bank with a unique mission. Triodos is growing fast, but still small enough for you to have significant impact on the definition of “great”.


As a member of a Scrum team you work in sprints on the user stories that your product owner has given highest priority. You work on new functionality that is needed by Triodos customers using internet- or mobile banking. The development team maintains an active dialogue with the product owner to make sure we build what has most business value.


The team will work on customer facing browser based and mobile applications. Context is a large project where Triodos is gradually replacing all customer facing applications by a more modern tech stack.  The front end applications will use services that are implemented by a back end team in Java.


Ambition of the team is to be able to deploy into production with high frequency. This means clean code, design for test, and a rigorous automated test harness are essential.


You do primarily front end development, using technologies like HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3. Experience with AngularJS, native app development and Java will be useful. You aim for continuous improvement in the technology as well as the process, both in your team and in the department as a whole. Within the developer guild you share knowledge and explore new technologies in regular guild meetings and pizza sessions.

jobs.title: Junior Java Software Developer
jobs.content:
Looklet


Looklet is a unique and digitally-forward company in the fashion industry. We improve the way retailers capture and market fashion by presenting a solution for the whole photo process - from the actual photo shoot to the point where an image is ready to publish.


Combining fashion, technology, and photography, we are not afraid to solve problems never solved before. We do not do "typical" or "ordinary". We work daily to achieve the best solution our clients can have: the world's best fashion image management solution. If you are looking for a fun and exciting workplace with talented and passionate colleagues, then you have arrived at the right place. We want you to be as curious and passionate as we are. We welcome initiative and bold new ideas that will help us move forward and stay ahead.


Our head office is located in Stockholm, Sweden, but we think globally.


Looklet - better content for the digital fashion world.


The Looklet Product


Online fashion performs better with the right type of content. Traditional photo shoots require clothes, stylists, photographers, models, make-up artists and assistants, to all be present and top-perform at once. With the Looklet solution, the model shoot and style process is decoupled and fully flexible, as the model and each piece of garment are shot at different times and pieced together.


Looklet's customers work with several of our pre-set, automated green-screen studios, often set-up at their locations. The garments on the photos are cut-out by our cloud-based graphic algorithms and then sent to the Look Creator software, where the customer's stylists combine models and clothes as they want. When the customers are done with a look, the image is automatically uploaded to their online shop and can be changed at any point.


The Looklet solution greatly impacts our clients' productivity while allowing for customized looks and improved conversion rates. As the customers use our solution to create their fashion images, nothing but the highest quality is accepted.


Development Organization


Our solution is truly innovative, using a combination of pure Java with JavaFX GUI built on top of an open-source stack in the cloud. We integrate off-the-shelf cameras and flash equipment with our own computer graphics algorithms.


The Looklet development department is based in Stockholm and is organised in agile cross-functional teams with full-stack software developers working together with hardware engineers and visual artists. Together, we make sure we have open discussions towards new solutions, along with keeping our code and product clean.


We are a diverse group of people as well. Here, you will be able to work along side fashion photographers, Harvard alumni, yoga teachers, and African tribal dancers. So feel free to be who you are. You are most welcome here.


Role


As one of our junior software developers, you will be integrated in a dynamic and ambitious team. As the Looklet solution is the first of its kind, we are looking for innovative and creative people who are able to take risks and think outside the box. Developing a unique product in a young team means you will do a lot of different things, everything from UX to image processing and backend work. By working with our qualified team you will have a platform where you can develop and bring out the best in Looklet while bringing out the best in you.


As a developer at Looklet you will work with technologies like Java, JavaFX, Spring, Guice, Maven, Bitbucket, Hibernate, Google Storage, Linux, Mac, Google Compute Engine and Mercurial.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
In our Engineering Center in Wegberg near Aachen we are working on the application and advancement of our powertrain related products. To strengthen our local team we are looking for a


Senior Software Engineer (m/f) – Powertrain


As Senior Software Engineer (m/f) – Powertrain you are responsible to develop and to test model-based software components for Diesel engine management systems. In your daily work you closely collaborate with our core development in Japan and the relevant internal departments in Europe.


In detail you

  • implement and integrate the software component into a software baseline,

  • test the software component using advanced testing tools,

  • develop software with a process compliant to automotive standards like Automotive SPICE, ISO26262 and according to quality objectives and

  • improve the MDB software development process and motivate its usage in the software department as process owner for the model-based software development process.


Your profile:



  • Engineering degree (information technology, electrical or control systems engineering) or comparable education

  • At least three years of professional experience in embedded software engineering

  • Strong experience with MBD function and software development tools (i. e. ASCET/Simulink/Target Link/RTW) and testing tools (MIL/SIL/HIL)

  • Experience with software engineering tools (compiler, linker, debugger, code analyzer, modeling and simulation tools, change and version management tools, testing tools etc.)

  • Practice in applying AUTOSAR software architecture and methodology

  • Good knowledge of vehicle/powertrain control systems

  • Experiences in the field of engine ECU/Diesel engine control systems and fundamental knowledge of fuel injection systems

  • Structured working approach and quality orientation

  • Ability to work independently but also in cooperation with a multicultural team

  • Good command of written and spoken English and German (business language is English)

  • Good PC command (MS Office)



Please apply online stating your availability, salary requirements and the account number 201615 in English.



DENSO AUTOMOTIVE Deutschland GmbH
HR Specialist Ms. Galina Kolander

jobs.title: Senior PHP Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced PHP developer who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment!



We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them up in Europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up Startups like Tirendo, nu3 and saatchiart.



Why are we different? - 5 reasons to work in the Project A environment:



(1) We are open for new technologies and we use them whenever it makes sense.



(2) We are 100% pragmatic. You will work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

(3) We know about the benefits of TDD, BDD and Clean Code and make use of it!

(4) We are not afraid of huge architectural challenges. For instance we developed our own e-commerce software called Spryker

(5) We live a strong interdisciplinary teamwork among web development, business-intelligence, marketing and operations and share our knowledge in Dev Talks and a regular IT Open Space.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Java developer who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment! We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them big in europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up a lot of startups like minodes and Intelipost.


We invite you to tell us about your career plans. Because of our broad portfolio we are able to find the perfect job for you, like backend/ frontend/ fullstack developer, DevOp oder teamlead

jobs.title: Software Design Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
Content Engineering is responsible for bringing in fresh content into the Meltwater Platform. The team in Berlin is focusing on Influencer Content, building suitable tools and algorithms, to provide our customers with the highest quality, most relevant and timely influencer information possible.


All of our solutions are fully web-based, offered as a service, and the technology portfolio ranges from ReactJS, Redux, Ruby on Rails applications in the frontend to ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ and Apache Storm’s stream processing framework in the backend.


We are looking for an experienced Software Design Engineer in Test, to help our Berlin team to build better software by developing advanced testing frameworks and tools.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer - JavaScript Angular - Provincia Perugia
jobs.content:
Vendini is looking for standout Developers to join our italian development team!


The Frontend Software Engineer role at Vendini consists in building and maintaining structured applications using clean, reusable and testable coding practices. Skills required for this role consist in a great understanding of object oriented programming, a good knowledge of Javascript, jQuery, HTML5 and CSS3, experience with Angular and a background in PHP frameworks are a great plus.


We are looking for a smart and talented developer with passion and drive for what he/she does.


Who will I be working with?
A team of 15 hardworking, smart and geeky devs, that love to code, write great software, and have fun with video games.


Is the working environment comfortable and stimulating?


We want you to feel comfortable at work, for this reason we provide you with the best tools available:



  • Comfortable desks

  • MAC or PC

  • Big DELL screens

  • Herman Miller Aeron chairs 

  • Casual dress code

  • Lunch catering every day

  • Kitchen with free snacks and drinks


To keep your engine running at full speed we organize, at our Italian office, monthly meetups and live coding sessions!


Where is the office located?
The Italian office is located in Gualdo Tadino (Perugia). It can be easily reached by car (free parking) or train (we are next to the train station).

jobs.title: Full-Stack Laravel Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Kuwait City, Kuwait
URL: www.ajar.com.kw

Who we are
Built by a passionate team of problem-solvers, Ajar Online is a mobile-inspired cloud service built for the real estate market in Kuwait and the GCC that uses technology to offer a quick and efficient online rent collection solution via SMS and email, making life easier for both landlords and tenants. As a growing startup, we are excited to start expanding our team to grow our operations in Kuwait and within the region. 

Ajar Online is an awarding-winning startup. Explore what we do in more detail on our website.

What we’re looking for
We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer to design, develop and enhance our core business software solution. The successful candidate will be able to build high-quality, innovative and fully performing software in compliance with coding standards and technical design. This job is also available for anyone outside of Kuwait as a "Remote Job"

What you’d have to do
  • Execute full life-cycle software development in a self-sufficient matter.
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code
  • Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility
  • Integrate software components into a fully functional software systems
  • Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures
  • Develop unit tests for self or others code when necessary.
  • Review code for bugs and defects including security loopholes within the logical structures. 
  • Comply with project plans and industry standards
  • Produce reports using MySQL on an “as needed basis”.

Skills
  • BS in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Required ability to swiftly develop software in PHP
  • Experience in developing web applications using at least one popular web framework 
  • Knowledgeable in ORM.
  • Expert in MVC best practices
  • Proficiency in Laravel 4 Framework
  • Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, MySQL using PhpMyAdmin
  • Preferable knowledge in cross-platform mobile development tools
  • Preferable knowledge in one or more of these languages; Java, Objective-C, Swift or C#.
  • Preferable Knowledge in Linux (Ubuntu) Administration

Benefits
Other than the usual benefits;
  • Stock Options.
  • 30 days paid leave.
  • Flexible Hours (with at least 4 hrs overlap with GMT+3).
  • Work remotely from anywhere!

To apply: Use the following link to apply: https://ajaronline.workable.com/j/71257A0749

jobs.title: Senior Java Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Darwinex es una start-up fintech (tecnología + finanzas + internet) con oficinas en Madrid y Londres. Hace 4 años empezamos a desarrollar una plataforma de social trading que hoy en día es una realidad. Nuestro objetivo es acercar el mejor talento de los mercados financieros a cualquier inversor en cualquier parte del mundo.


Buscamos ingenieros que contribuyan con su talento al crecimiento del equipo de backend de Darwinex. Si te consideras un apasionado de la programación no dudes en ponerte en contacto con nosotros, te estamos buscando.


Queremos a gente a quien le apasionen los retos, que busque siempre la mejora continua y la superación personal. En Darwinex no hay límite de crecimiento, eres tú el que determina tu propio futuro dentro de la empresa.


Te ofrecemos un ambiente único en el que crecer a nivel profesional y personal. Además, por ser parte de Darwinex disfrutarás de las siguientes ventajas:



  • Salario competitivo (de verdad)

  • Masaje mensual gratuito para todo el mundo

  • Fruta, bebidas, café, galletas, té, etc. siempre a tu disposición

  • Oficina en el centro de Madrid, junto al Parque del Retiro

  • Elige tu silla, ordenador, teclado, ratón y monitor

  • Presupuesto anual para conferencias y cursos a tu elección

  • Kit Darwinex de bienvenida

  • Un gran equipo con el que trabajar, y no lo decimos por decir :-)

  • Pizza & beers cada 2 semanas

jobs.title: Take a lead role as Java developer/architect and help us grow!
jobs.content:
Zuhlke is a European software engineering consultancy that helps businesses turn ideas into reality. We need people who are capable, talented, and engaged to help build systems for our clients, based mainly in our expanding Shoreditch office. We take on interesting projects in many domains, including media, finance, heavy engineering, and medical devices.


Your job will involve working closely with clients to develop, test, and ship software that meets their needs. You will be looking both to contribute to the company and to grow personally.


Our reputation is fundamental to our business, so our culture emphasizes quality, reliability and respect. As a privately-held company owned by past and present employees, and run by engineers, Zuhlke takes a long-term view. For example, you will receive twenty days training per year, including a budget to support activities such as conference attendance, our annual technical camp, and participation in focused topic teams. We like our staff to be technically flexible so, if you don’t have a required skill now, we can support you learning it.


Your job will include:



  • Helping our clients understand what they really need

  • Building quality systems to satisfy those needs

  • Working collaboratively with colleagues and clients

  • Keeping technically sharp

  • Getting things done

  • Sometimes travelling to other locations in the UK and mainland Europe


You will benefit from:



  • A generous allowance for training (9% of your time and a budget)

  • An achievement-based career path where you can gain responsibility while remaining technical

  • A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package


Our work is mainly at or within an hour's travel from our Shoreditch office.


If this appeals, then please get in touch.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

jobs.title: .Net Developer sr.
jobs.content:
Ben jij de ervaren .Net ontwikkelaar die onze applicaties naar een hoger plan gaat tillen?

State of the art applicaties ontwikkelen die bijdragen aan een professionelere dienstverlening; daar krijg jij energie van! Als .Net specialist ben jij de ontwikkelaar die in verschillende projecten duikt en daarbinnen ijzersterke applicaties bouwt. De Microsoft-ontwikkelstraat geeft jou de mogelijkheid om spijkers met koppen te slaan en alle voordelen die .Net te bieden heeft, te benutten.

Vaak begin je de dag met een scrumsessie, waarin je teamleden vertellen waar ze staan en/of tegenaan lopen in het project waar jullie samen aan werken. Als senior .Net ontwikkelaar ben je van alle markten thuis, adviseer je vanuit deze rol je collega’s en sta je junior ontwikkelaars bij in hun werkzaamheden. Hiermee geef je sturing aan het team en neem je waar nodig de rol van coach op je. Maar met jouw expertise ben je ook in de uitvoerende taken hard nodig. Je reviewt detailontwerpen van applicaties en bouwt applicatiecomponenten op basis van gedetailleerde ontwerpspecificaties. Ook documenteer je bouwtesten, zorg je ervoor dat applicaties binnen de infrastructuur geïntegreerd worden en handel je incident- en probleemmeldingen af.

Ook onze managers hebben baat bij jouw .Net-kennis; dus ook zij gaan graag het gesprek met je aan. Vakinhoudelijk kan niemand om je heen, ben je de vraagbaak bij uitstek én voel je de verantwoordelijkheid om werkzaamheden goed te stroomlijnen. Je treed op als spreekbuis van de ontwikkelteams in overleggen met zowel de interne, als externe stakeholders.

Het Nederland van nu zoekt ICT’ers. Bij de Rijksoverheid werk je als ICT-specialist aan belangrijke thema’s als privacy, security en cybercrime. Ook draag je bij aan ontwikkelingen in big data, cloud-oplossingen en bring your own device. Zo werk je mee aan het Nederland van nu en van de toekomst.

jobs.title: .Net Developer mr.
jobs.content:
Ben jij de .Net ontwikkelaar die praktische software-oplossingen bouwt?


State of the art applicaties ontwikkelen die bijdragen aan een professionelere dienstverlening; daar krijg jij energie van! Als .Net-ontwikkelaar duik je in verschillende uitdagende projecten en ga je toepasbare software ontwikkelen om ijzersterke applicaties mee te bouwen. De Microsoft-ontwikkelstraat geeft jou de mogelijkheid om spijkers met koppen te slaan en alle voordelen die .Net te bieden heeft, te benutten. Vaak begin je de dag met een scrumsessie, waarin je teamleden vertellen waar ze staan en/of tegenaan lopen in het project waar jullie samen aan werken. Je voert reviews uit van detailontwerpen van applicaties en bouwt applicatiecomponenten op basis van gedetailleerde ontwerpspecificaties. Je bedenkt objectgeoriënteerde softwareoplossingen en weet deze te implementeren. Het is belangrijk dat je bekend bent met design patterns en met de laatste ontwikkelingen in .Net-omgevingen. Ook documenteer je bouwtesten, zorg je ervoor dat applicaties binnen de infrastructuur geïntegreerd worden en handel je incident- en probleemmeldingen af.


Het Nederland van nu zoekt ICT’ers. Bij de Rijksoverheid werk je als ICT-specialist aan belangrijke thema’s als privacy, security en cybercrime. Ook draag je bij aan ontwikkelingen in big data, cloud-oplossingen, mobiele oplossingen en bring your own device. Zo werk je mee aan het Nederland van nu.

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
Ben jij de medior Java ontwikkelaar die het verschil kan maken?


Als medior Java developer bij de Belastingdienst realiseer je applicaties, die er toe doen en waarmee we het verschil maken. Je ontwikkelt applicatieonderdelen en unittests. Je brengt complexe processen terug tot eenvoudige componenten en bedenkt creatieve oplossingen voor technische problemen met als resultaat goed functionerende applicaties. Vanuit het besef dat applicatieontwikkeling meer is dan alleen programmeren, bouw je naast je Java kennis een T-shape profiel op, met kennis en ervaring van ontwerpen en geautomatiseerd testen.


Onze 250 Java ontwikkelaars realiseren applicaties, die direct impact hebben op onze samenleving. De Online Aangifte applicatie is er één waarmee we miljoenen mensen bereiken. Maar onze Java bouwers doen meer, bijvoorbeeld voor de Douane en FIOD. Dat doen we in zo’n 70 groot- en kleinschalige projecten en met 100 multidisciplinaire scrumteams, waardoor er voor jou steeds weer een nieuwe uitdaging ligt te wachten. We werken in een Agile-ontwikkelomgeving met standaardisatie op ‘proven technology’. Dat biedt ons houvast en geeft ons zekerheid om goed functionerende applicaties te ontwikkelen. Uiteraard kijken we ook vooruit, naar welke ontwikkelingen er zijn en kan jij een rol spelen in hoe we deze toe kunnen passen in onze Java ontwikkelstraat.


Bij de Belastingdienst krijg je volop de ruimte om jezelf blijvend te ontwikkelen Als software engineer heb je de mogelijkheid om actief je kennis uit te bouwen, bijvoorbeeld door (onder werktijd) bijeenkomsten van onze Java vakgroep, conferenties en hackathons bij te wonen, diverse opleidingen te volgen en certificeringen/diploma’s te behalen. Daar profiteren niet alleen jezelf en wij van, maar ook de burgers en bedrijven van Nederland. Een goed voorbeeld hiervan is de Online Aangifte applicatie, waarmee we in 2015 een Computable award wisten te winnen voor het beste ICT-project binnen de overheid.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Android Senior Software Engineer to work on HERE Maps for Android.


If you are passionate about innovation, software, and smartphones, eager to learn and work with new game-changing technologies, and want to work in an entrepreneurial environment together with a team of very motivated individuals in HERE's Berlin office,  then you are the perfect fit for our team.  A strong track record of developing and delivering world-class client-side native smartphone applications is a must.


Key responsibilities:



  • Design and build advanced location-based functionality for the Android platform

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features, with a focus on end-to-end quality

  • Create intuitive, custom UI controls and interfaces that match our great user experience

  • Write unit and acceptance tests to validate robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability

  • Create and maintain technical documentation for new features and applications

jobs.title: Backend Developer
jobs.content:
This is where you come into play:


As part of our Potsdam-based team of engineers, Kweak is recruiting a backend developer to help build our messaging platform and API. Success in this role requires a solution-oriented mindset plus strong Python, API design and maintainable software development skills. If you’re curious to learn, passionate about emerging technology and motivated to change the world, we want to hear from you!

jobs.title: Experience with Java & interested in joining the e-commerce revolution?
jobs.content:
With over 6 million customers, 28 million monthly visits and 10 million products, bol.com is the most successful online retailer in The Netherlands and Belgium. Over 1.000 people – including more than 300 IT-professionals, and 40+ Scrum teams – strive to make bol.com into the best, most customer-centric shop possible. Is that something you’d like to contribute to?


Your Role



  • You develop, test and implement Java solutions, both for our shopping-platform and back-end processes.

  • You work in an autonomous team; together you oversee software from development to production.

  • You are and feel responsible for your software; “You Build IT, You Run IT, You Love IT”!

  • You innovate on a daily basis, both from a functional and a technical standpoint.


Who you are


A Software Engineer who is passionate about modern (open source) solutions. You have a proven ability to comprehend functional requirements, and can translate those insights into scalable solutions. You cherish performance, security and craftsmanship. You keep close tabs on IT-developments and love to be a front-runner.


As a Software Engineer you will work in one of the three “feature spaces” within our IT organization:



  • The Retail Platform Space focuses on our retail platform. The ambition is to develop a best in class toolbox that seamlessly facilitates buying, product enrichment, sales and reporting.

  • The Shopping Experience Space is all about our customers, so optimizing the customer experience is key. Focus areas range from responsive websites, so information is presented perfectly on all devices, to personalization on the bol.com platform.

  • The Fulfillment Network Space works on projects that help us meet or even exceed customer expectations each day. CRM platforms, the development of our Warehouse Management System and supporting logistics processes are a few examples.


Our Software Engineers ‘breathe’ IT-technology, and their Java skills are vital to bol.com’s ongoing success. With so many Scrum teams conducting such a wide range of projects, bol.com offers engineers constant challenges to be taken on as a team.

jobs.title: Developer  WordPress
jobs.content:
Tervetuloa huippujoukkoomme rakentamaan digitaalista näkyvyyttä maan johtaville markkinoijille. 


Vastaat responsiivisten sivustojen teknisestä suunnittelusta ja koostamisesta. Olet tiiviisti mukana tiimin suunnitteluprosessissa tarjousvaiheesta asiakkaiden käyttökoulutukseen ja sivustojen ylläpitoon sekä jatkokehitykseen. WordPress on toinen luontosi, mutta olet avoimen utelias myös muille julkaisujärjestelmille.

jobs.title: Crazy Full-Stack Folk for one-time life opportunity in Asia
jobs.content:
SeeChic is looking for full-stack Django developer to build a totally new version of our backend. We are using Magento’s for the moment, but we’ve already reached its limits. Yes, because we are aiming to become the leader in south east asia! (job is based in Singapore, we can work-out a remote work for a time given but not as a long-term solution)


Responsibilities



  • You will report to the CEO and working very closely with me (product manager/django developer/crazy tech visionaire, never take “it’s not possible” for an answer). And yes, this position is a possibility to become a team leader. In SeeChic, we do not give a title to give a title, you have to earn it.

  • Building from scratch the whole infrastructure in collaboration with me : from the product information management system, to the front-end.

  • Nobody will tell you how to do smth, we are looking for an expert willing to learn and find solutions.

jobs.title: Open Stack Developer
jobs.content: We are building the cloud for the world’s largest communication provider– and that’s going to host the world’s largest network! We are looking for domain experts to join our team – to improve and contribute to openstack among other things.

jobs.title: Senior Modeling Scientist, Prospecting
jobs.content:
The Prospecting team’s vision is to help our customers better understand their audiences and to deliver relevant advertising across all internet media. The team builds and operates real time prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge machine learning techniques and advertising delivery systems. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of predictive models, use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second, and deliver advertising to appropriate audiences 24x7.

We are looking for top tier talent to solve day-to-day advertising campaign issues, identify opportunities to improve our machine learning and advertising delivery technologies, and implement those improvements to reach relevant audiences on behalf of our advertisers. We are interested in modeling scientists with a strong production development background as well as a keen interest in data analysis, machine learning and control systems.

You will work within a world class modeling group of scientists and engineers that spans multiple product teams and collaborates closely with our scientific advisors, Stanford professors Jerome Friedman and Trevor Hastie. As leaders in the fields of data mining and statistics, both professors take an active interest in Quantcast and our ongoing work.



RESPONSIBILITIES




    • Design, develop and operate statistical models and algorithms to deliver performance at scale

    • Investigate system issues, identify root causes, and design solutions

    • Prototype solutions and conduct data analyses to solve large-scale inference and control problems

    • Improve existing ad targeting products and introduce new products to delight our customers

    • Implement algorithms for production systems responsible for real time audience targeting on Real Time Bidding (RTB) exchanges

    • Work cross-functionally with other teams to develop best practices in campaign setup, execution and optimization

    • Be part of on-call rotation (about 4x a year)- we build and operate our own products!

    • Generate and review proposals for further research and development directions

    • Participate in machine learning study group and present findings to stakeholders as needed

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Have you ever had a dream so real you felt awake?  Where you helped decide how to build an awesome product in a sweet location with smart, cool developers?  Take the red pill and come join the Bluebeam engineering team in our Chicago office.



Our engineers develop intuitive applications that revolutionize how people collaborate and share data in real time. As part of the Bluebeam team, you will use your expertise to design and develop customer centric applications. You will work in a fast-paced environment were product delivery cycles are measured in months rather than years. You won’t ever see a 300-page specification document here.  Instead, we work closely with product managers and customers to extend core functionality as well as design and implement new products and features that make a difference every day for our users.



As part of our engineering team, you’ll work with Xamarin to develop native macOS and iOS applications. You’ll help us solve complicated problems in areas such as code sharing across platforms, graphics performance, and intuitive interface design.  



(At this point, you’re thinking, “What the frak?! C# development on Mac and iOS??” So here’s the deal:  Bluebeam is dedicated to a multi-platform experience. Xamarin lets us share code between native Windows, iOS and macOS applications while maintaining the look and feel of the native UI.  Trust us, it works great!)



So if you are looking for a career where you can develop applications that provide best-in-class functionality and have a direct impact on some of the largest design and engineering projects, Bluebeam is the place for you. 



What you’ll do



  • Collaborate with your team and other stakeholders to produce high quality code

  • Assist in the design, development, testing, and deployment for one of following applications:

    • the Mac version of Revu (our Windows flagship application )

    • iOS applications for iPad and iPhones





What we’d like to see in you



  • Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field

  • 5+ years of software development experience

  • Proven experience developing end-user software using Windows .NET technologies particularly C#

  • “Agile” software development methodology experience

  • Test-driven development experience

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions

  • Xcode and Objective-C familiarity

  • macOS development experience (not a deal breaker, but if you don't have this, we'd like you to enjoy working on a macOS system!) 



If you think you are a good match for the Bluebeam team, please send us the following:



  • Resume

  • A Cover letter that reflects your personality and your interest in Bluebeam and this role specifically (no generics please!)



Want to see what you might be working on?


http://www.bluebeam.com/us/products/revu/ipad.asp


http://www.bluebeam.com/us/products/revu/mac/



Learn even more about Bluebeam here: http://careers.bluebeam.com/

jobs.title: PostgreSQL Guru
jobs.content:
Sharada has immediate need for a seasoned PostgreSQL expert to lead a number of key initiatives.

The ideal candidate possesses hands-on, in-depth knowledge and experience in all facets of Postgres including but not limited to day-to-day administration and troubleshooting, performance tuning, query optimization, storage, partitioning, replication, physical design, foreign data wrappers, security and analytics.
