jobs.title: Staff Engineer / Team Lead, Inventory
jobs.content: This tight-knit group of software engineers based in Singapore is tasked with developing and running Quantcast's real-time bidding infrastructure at its high-performance network edge - a world-class, globally-distributed software infrastructure handling tens of billions of real-time transactions per day, currently up to 2 millions per second. Members of the Inventory team are passionate about designing, building and running high-throughput, low-latency systems. Whether it's for a code one-liner or an entirely new design, these developers tirelessly tweak, optimize, re-architect, and refactor until the last drop of performance has been juiced from the system. A candidate for this position will have a proven track record in leading the design and development of large-scale distributed computing systems or high-availability real-time systems. This person understands  networking well, perhaps has developed their own distributed protocol, high-availability network component or similar. This person  is able to lead the effort on large-scale projects, can translate business requirements into development opportunities, shape projects and lead the development effort whilst getting his or her hands dirty. While many companies have globally distributed infrastructures with high traffic demands, Quantcast may be the only one of these in which you will be expected to have your hands on the system of a very large scale, pushing mission-critical production code within a matter of weeks and leading the effort soon thereafter.

jobs.title: CTO's Right Hand - Software Developer
jobs.content: Software developer to assist the CTO in expanding the software capabilities and functionality of our system, and becoming a key team player as backup to the CTO.  Will work with the company's founders and CTO to respond to growing market demands for increased functions and interfaces with partner software.  Ideal candidate will be located in southern California, but remote locations acceptable for the proper candidate.

jobs.title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
jobs.content:
Position Description


As a member of the Development team, the Software Quality Assurance Analyst is an active member of one or more Agile Scrum development teams. The Software Quality Assurance Analyst will participate in the planning of payment software development cycles to ensure that each planned item is sufficiently defined and testable. During each cycle, the analyst will test items as they are completed to meet Shift4’s quality standards.


A successful candidate for this position will be able to understand software requirements, create test plans and test cases, execute test cases, articulate test results, and objectively assess production readiness from a quality perspective. Additionally, the candidate must be able to effectively juggle multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.


Essential Functions



  • Identify and test software defects

  • Create effective test plans and test cases

  • Document and execute test cases and articulate test results

  • Validate whether software requirements have been met

  • Objectively assess production readiness from a quality perspective

  • Track quality assurance metrics such as defect densities and defect counts

  • Review user feedback to determine how to test items

  • Suggest process improvements

  • Other duties as assigned by management

jobs.title: DevOps/Automation Lead or Manager
jobs.content:
What We Need


We are looking for a strong leader to join our Automation & Dev Tools Team. You will be working with cutting-edge technologies, highly-adept engineers, and have the opportunity to create a first-class Automation & Dev Tools team. Our next DevOps guru should have strong management skills, solid understanding of various software delivery methodologies, and Computer Science fundamentals including databases, algorithms and problem solving techniques.


What You Will Do



  • Manage and lead a team of badass engineers

  • As we grow, mentor and grow new engineers

  • Coach and align your team members to build a highly-efficient and reliable automation infrastructure

  • Develop automation frameworks for Kareo’s new platform that will be used by the product development teams

  • Build out and enhance Kareo’s continuous delivery pipeline to deliver Microservices to production

  • Be a thought leader for principles and technology that will help our engineers continue to do amazing work with ever improving efficiency

  • Collaborate with Network Operations to bridge engineering and operational concepts to help bring our software to life in production with the least amount of human effort

  • Help us ship high quality software as fast as possible all the time!

jobs.title: PHP Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking mid to senior level PHP developers to work full-time contributing to the success of our SaaS platform. With more than 5,000 customers in both the enterprise and SMB space, our developers get to make a big impact on the applications and markets they serve.


We are looking for developers who have experience in some sort of object-oriented PHP  framework (we use Symfony), and have made contributions to production applications. As a PHP developer at PrintSites, you will be responsible for crafting features from idea to production, including collaborating with stakeholders, prototyping solutions, building the actual thing, debugging and testing, and working with QA.


Looking to expand your skills beyond PHP? We also use Python (Django) and JavaScript (Ember, Backbone, Node.js). You’ll get a wide berth to select the right tool for the right job and have plenty of opportunity to grow.


Tools we use


Git, Jenkins, Aegir, Ansible, Xdebug


JIRA, Confluence


PhpStorm


Linux, Vagrant, Memcached, Varnish


and lots more...

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Fullstack
jobs.content:
With 1.4 million vehicles, mobile.de is the largest online vehicle trade site in Germany. It is part of mobile.de GmbH, which runs additional sites in Italy, Romania, Poland and France, featuring more than 40,000 merchants. The mobile.de GmbH employs 140 coworkers at Dreilinden just outside of Berlin and is a part of the eBay Group. This is an excellent opportunity to work for one of the most challenging product development organizations in eBay Germany. We support the entire mobile.de platform including our international marketplaces, mobile devices, and build critical technology to build the best of class experience in the vehicle market.


We're seeking a professional individual to join our team in Berlin as


Software Engineer (m/f), Fullstack


You are an expert in backend technologies and do shy not away from front-end technologies?


You are a self-starter, a problem solver; have a keen eye for clean and test-driven code?


You'll like working with us!


We work in small focused project teams following an agile methodology. Cross functional teams including product management, product development, and UX work on a daily basis to create successful products that have impact and delight our customers.


Your profile:


• Passion for clean and elegantly simple code


• Designing and implementing performing, scalable websites


• Excellent programming skills in Java including Java 8 features


• Solid JavaScript, HTML 5 and CSS skills, experience with node.js


• Curious about new technologies and languages


• Lean & data-driven mindset, including analytics review & A/B testing


• Active partner for product management


• Coaching junior colleagues


• Fluent English required, German is a strong plus


What we offer:


• Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce, professionalism and a good sense of humor


• A competitive salary, great benefits and an excellent working environment


• A potential for career advancement in just about any line of business and the opportunities to work almost anywhere in the world within eBay Inc.


• Silicon Valley Amenities (iPhones and MacBooks, Ping-Pong and kicker tables, volleyball and basketball courts, free coffee and juice, tasty subsidized lunches, a nice forest for walking and thinking and a free on-campus gym with trainers)

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description:


Our mobile team consists of developers who are passionate about bringing their skills and expertise to create mobile experiences that engage the user.  We seek candidates who can create clean, scalable code quickly in iterative cycles.  


- Do you look at other apps in the play store and say to yourself “I can do a better job at creating that app”?


- Do you toss and turn at night thinking about ways to improve what you’re working on?


 - Do you eagerly await the next Google I/O and keep an eye out for the next innovative additions to the SDK?


If this sounds like you, we have a spot for you on a team that is making a huge impact for a company that is truly going places and one who is committed to mobile.


Responsibilities




  • Design and develop native mobile applications for Android

  • Integrate mobile apps with RESTful web services

  • Work with UX Designers, Mobile Architects and other Developers to build enterprise mobile solutions

  • Work as part of an agile team on leading edge technologies


___


Raise Engineering:


Our software engineers are solving problems at scale for our online, gift card marketplace. Our user base and e-commerce transactions are growing exponentially. The challenges of keeping our services running 24x7, and adding new features to accelerate our business, all while moving incrementally to a continuous-deployment, microservice architecture are all awesome problems to solve. An understanding and commitment to our team approach to software development is of primary importance. Teams build software here. Besides obvious technical strengths, we look for passion for well-crafted software, professionalism, drive to learn new technologies, the joy of building solutions for our business and users, and the desire to cultivate a challenging, innovative, and supportive engineering culture.


Engineering teams at Raise have a great deal of autonomy and independence, with real ownership of the products and features they build. This role requires a unique balance of software-development skill and product sense — so the ideal candidate will have experience building substantial customer-facing products or services.


Impact- Raise is an engineering culture at its core. Our goal is to create an optimal environment where engineers regularly see and feel the difference they make.


Elegance - We care about code. Every engineer, from leadership to individual contributor, code on a daily basis.


Tackling Challenges - We don’t believe in being fast followers. Instead we’re focused on creating amazing experiences for customers while solving problems they knew existed.


Professional Growth - Each engineer has an individual career plan carved out for them upon joining Raise. Whether you want to be an individual contributor or have aspirations for leadership, we’ll work to help you realize your career goals.


Smart Team - Great people want to work around great people. We understand that, so we’ve created a thorough and systematic hiring process to ensure we only hire top quality engineers.


Disruptive Goals - Raise engineers think BIG. We never settle for mediocrity and are excited about our future.

jobs.title: Lead Backend Developer
jobs.content:
With 1.4 million vehicles, mobile.de is the largest online vehicle trade site in Germany. This is an excellent opportunity to work for one of the most challenging product development organizations in eBay Germany. We support the entire mobile.de platform including our international marketplaces, mobile devices, and build critical technology to build the best of class experience in the vehicle market.

Mobile.de is hiring in Berlin! The Technology group is looking for a


Lead Backend Developer (m/f), Trust & Safety Team


The Trust & Safety team creates algorithms and applications to automatically detect fraud on the site as well as to improve the quality of listings and the communication of sellers and dealers. As a Lead Developer Trust & Safety you will be responsible for choosing the right technology and further develop our fraud and quality detection algorithms as well as our dealer rating and communication platform.


Job responsibilities:



  • Further develop our fraud and quality detection, communication and dealer rating platform

  • Own the entire development lifecycle from specification to deployment

  • Be an active partner for Product management in order to provide the best value for stakeholders and our customers

  • Innovate technology, process and product with your team

  • Leading and coaching junior developers


Job requirements:



  • 5+ years’ experience as a Java developer with a deep understanding of the surrounding technology ecosystem

  • Strong architecture and design experience

  • You are an absolute pro in Java / MVC / Spring4 / Hibernate / MySQL / Linux / MongoDB

  • You speak HTTP and REST like your mother tongue

  • Ideally you also have knowledge in machine learning, pattern matching and text mining technologies and previous experience in fraud detection

  • Solid understanding of up-to-date front-end technologies (Javascript, modern JS frameworks, CSS)

  • You firmly believe in lean and agile development (Kanban / Scrum)

  • You get up to speed with new systems and concepts quickly

  • You understand that quality is not assured by a QA engineer, but by the team

  • You believe in cross-functional teams and know that responsibility does not end with deployment

  • Proven excellence in analysing, designing, implementing, running and maintaining large scale distributed scalable solutions for the Web

  • Ability to plan strategically and execute in a result-oriented manner

  • Ability to thrive in a cross-functional environment while juggling multiple responsibilities

  • Passion for keeping up to date with the latest developments in the industry

  • Outstanding communication skills, ability to explain technical decisions to colleagues at all levels and from all trades

  • Excellent English language skills, German language skills not required, but a plus


What we offer:



  • A competitive salary, great benefits and an excellent working environment

  • Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce and a great sense of humor

  • Potential for career advancement in just about any line of business and the opportunities to work almost anywhere in the world within eBay Inc.

  • Silicon Valley Amenities (iPhones and MacBooks, Ping-Pong and kicker tables, volleyball and basketball courts, free coffee and juice, tasty subsidized lunches, a nice forest for walking and thinking and a free on-campus gym with trainers)

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Concur R&D
jobs.content:
As a core member of Concur’ s Minnesota R&D Center, you will be designing and building the next generation of our end-to-end solutions spanning Concur’ s  product line.  We run small teams with a purpose, so that our engineers have full visibility and ownership of the project, including architecture, design, development, and operations.  You believe in being a team player, collaborating and communicating with technical and non-technical audiences.    You bring a result-driven focus, high enthusiasm, energy, confidence, curiosity, and a sense of fun.
Concur has a customer base of over 30 million end users and year-over-year growth exceeding 50%.  As a Software Engineer with Concur you will be working on solutions that are key to Concur’ s product delivery and aggressive growth.


In the first 12 months you will be:




    • Developing features at all levels of Concur’s technical stack:  You will be building solutions from end-to-end— for example; standing up new services, coding business logic, improving the UI, as well as taking ownership for product quality and delivery

    • Delivering features in the cloud: You will be creating and scaling features and services that utilize Concur’s cloud as well as other commercial platforms such as AWS.

    • Agile Development:  You’ll use Agile Development (Scrum, XP, etc.), Continuous Integration and DevOps concepts (automated deployments, monitoring/alerting, etc.)  You will be collaborating and working with you team members to constantly improve our development process so we can quickly respond to opportunities across our business.
      Owning the software lifecycle from design to delivery: As part of Concur R&D you will be contributing to architecture, design, development, and operations

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - UI/UX
jobs.content: DataFox is looking for a design-oriented, risk-taking software engineer who can take initiative and think creatively to solve complex data problems. This role will complement our engineering- and finance-heavy backgrounds to round out a product team revolutionizing the way business analysts find and track high-growth companies.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
AdParlor provides an industry leading software as a service platform that enables the world's largest advertisers to efficiently manage and optimize their social advertising spend on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Yahoo, Pinterest, and other social marketplaces. Our team is currently building the next generation of our platform and looking for experienced individuals to contribute to the desktop and mobile initiatives at AdParlor.


The AdParlor business is currently reinventing today’s approach to social ad management with web applications that:



  • Consume and interface with multiple backend APIs for an ever growing list of top social networks and asynchronous services

  • Provide an easy-to-use client-facing interface with flexible reporting and permissions

  • Leverage the latest and greatest web and mobile technologies to deliver a world-class enterprise ad management platform

  • Include a robust tracking system designed to track return on investment and lifetime value of users for our advertisers


The Software Engineering team is located in Kansas City and is comprised of backend engineers, frontend engineers, product designers, and product managers. The Software Engineer position will work closely with the frontend and backend development teams and reports directly to the Manager of Product & Engineering.


POSITION OVERVIEW
This Senior Software Engineer is responsible for collaborating with product management and other developers to bring new features to our platform. This position requires a strong attention to detail and the ability to develop simple and elegant solutions to unique frontend challenges. The ideal candidate for this position is a self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment that often allows you to take your own initiatives. Primary duties include:



  1. Partnership: Collaborating with peers in the technical and business teams on architectural design and implementation.

  2. App Development and Maintenance: Building and maintaining high-performance web apps that leverage new technologies.

  3. Leadership: Mentoring junior developers on best practices in programming and testing, structure, implementation, and performance.

  4. Communication: Interacting with stakeholders to explain new features or diagnose issues.

jobs.title: Sr. Web Developer
jobs.content:
Who We're Looking For


We're looking for a passionate and experienced Web Developer who is self-motivated and can work in a collaborative team environment. You should take pride in what you build and you're always striving to improve both yourself and your work. While you won't be designing product experiences per se, you will be directly responsible for the quality of the experience that is ultimately delivered to our users so you should have a strong sense of good interactive design principles. You should understand the balance between pixel-perfect execution and releasing quickly and consistently. You should be able to work in a full-time capacity in our office located in Santa Monica, California.


What You Will Be Doing


You will be building and maintaining web applications and crafting user experiences that are optimized to be both easy and delightful to use. Your output will be code that is performant, cleanly written, and humanly readable. Your contribution will be helping our team solve real problems for real people and building products that help those people live better lives. You will work with us to identify issues and opportunities within our products and expand our capabilities and competencies to address them effectively.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thorn invites software engineers in the San Francisco Bay Area to join the Thorn Innovation Lab to contribute their talent to create new technology interventions to fight child sexual exploitation. The lab's areas of focus will include human trafficking, darkweb child abuse/exploitation content and social platform cyber safety. Technically, projects in these areas will span a wide variety of engineering and analysis topics relevant to cybersecurity and intelligence including adaptive crawling/scraping, statistical analysis, search, machine learning (NLP, computer vision, sentiment analysis), entity resolution, data pipeline development, UI/API design, and more.


Engineers will participate in both product development as well as broad exploration in the space – working to identify new possible interventions. Engineers must be big thinkers, but also executors,  interested in solving hard problems that require more than just technical skills – including partnership development and learning new subject matter areas.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Who We Are


YogaGlo, Inc. is a health and wellness company. Our products offer online yoga classes from world class teachers straight to your personal device or home television. Our culture has a strong focus on craftsmanship and continuous learning, where you will be expected to contribute.


What You Will Be Doing


Build & maintain backend tooling, services and APIs while working alongside a varied group of designers and developers. Create new product features, along with our other team members, with a strong emphasis on user experience and performance.


Who We Are Looking For


We’re looking for a passionate engineer who is a self-starter but can also work in a collaborative team environment. If you enjoy designing APIs and like working on challenging problems, then we want to hear from you.

jobs.content:

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.content:

YogaGlo, Inc. is a health and wellness company. Our products offer online yoga classes from world class teachers straight to your personal device or home television. Our culture has a strong focus on craftsmanship and continuous learning, where you will be expected to contribute.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Engineer
jobs.content:
CyberU is a part of the Cornerstone Startup Accelerator, and we are looking for someone who can create the vision for and execute on the infrastructure for a scalable online video and e-commerce learning platform. If you are smart, passionate, resourceful, and want to be a visionary, founding team member who will help craft the technical architecture and direction of our product, then this is opportunity for you. The ability and passion to design and implement something from nothing is a must, along with long term vision for architecting quality code. Come join our team, and get in on the ground floor of a startup that will revolutionize the consumer learning space.


In this role you will...



  • Work with team to define, document, and communicate the core system platform

  • Ensure the platform meets the needs of front-end application teams as well as internal and end users

  • Ensure platform scalability and performance

  • Ensure the platform is easy to deploy and sustain

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Position Summary:


Reporting to the VP of Technology, the Software Engineer will help develop our proprietary platform -- combining vehicle telematics, a carsharing reservation system, predictive analytics, a customer portal and mobile app.  This is your chance to create something awesome from scratch, with a clean slate and no legacy systems!


Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Deliver complete, high performance web applications for desktop and mobile devices

  • Automate and support the data value chain (vehicle to backend, to front-end), including migration of prototype algorithms into production intent server-based scripts

  • Integrate and develop REST APIs

  • Build client-side user authentication and authorization between multiple applications

jobs.title: Web Application Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for a passionate developer to be the next member of our small developer-owned company (everyone here writes code every day). The ideal candidate would have extensive experience with C#, .NET, and SQL Server. We are looking for someone who has experience building production web applications and is as passionate about helping customers as they are about working with new technologies. We need a candidate that is confident and values freedom (we work almost exclusively from home), but is humble enough to ask questions when they are stuck. We need a candidate who wants to build new things, but doesn’t mind rolling up their sleeves and doing some maintenance work. We know this is a hard mix to find, but if you feel like you’re up for the challenge, please get in touch!

jobs.title: Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Our customer base is growing quickly, and we want your combination of sharp technical and warm people skills to help our customers solve problems and get the most out of their databases at Compose. We operate a fleet of various databases, so there is something for everyone: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, RethinkDB, and likely many more!


If you are a developer, DevOps/SRE magician, or database junkie and know how to help developers with technical questions, we want to talk to you. You will be most effective if you have an inquisitive nature, are technically-inclined and love to learn. We are not just looking to fight fires, we are looking to prevent them. We pride ourselves in providing top-notch support and guidance, so being able to communicate effectively with empathy and compassion is a must.


This is the perfect position for a motivated learner who wants to gain experience within a vibrant team focused on building an intuitive and customer-focused product. Spending time with our customers and product will let you interact with all sorts of interesting characters and will help you grow into a high-end distributed systems engineering position (we need those too, so if you start on support and do a great job, there is a huge amount of room for growth).


We're a distributed team and we work across many different time zones. If you're a night owl, an early riser, or somewhere in between, we're happy to accommodate untraditional work schedules -- our worldwide customers often need help at odd hours!


Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.


At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.


We look forward to meeting you!


Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.

jobs.title: Software Test Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, Inc. Job Postings


The Opportunity


Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories (SEL) seeks a professional, innovative and meticulous individual for our Software Engineer position in PC Software. If you are looking for an opportunity to work for a great company, with excellent benefits and an outstanding reputation for quality, then we invite you to join our technical team!


Software Test Automation Engineer

  • Participate in project change control board meetings to review and evaluate product change requests.

  • Evaluate, select, and implement new technologies for existing and future product.

  • Supervise and mentor Associate Software Engineers and Test Technicians in state-of-the-art testing practices.

  • To grow the expertise of software personnel, determine the type of skills and knowledge required for them to meet or exceed the needs of development projects.

  • Develop and conduct internal training programs. Define training standards for personnel.

  • Continuously identify, measure, follow, and improve R&D processes.

  • Other duties as assigned.

jobs.title: Software Engineer III
jobs.content:
Software Engineer III | Current Openings













Essential Duties:

Software Engineer III | Current Openings

jobs.title: Test Lead
jobs.content:
Are you looking for a great opportunity to showcase your IT knowledge and skills? Consider this opportunity with the Central Agencies I&IT Cluster, in the role of Test Lead.


What can I expect to do in this role?


In this role you will:
• lead the testing practice of agile project teams using test-driven development
• establish and implement common testing practices for all types of software and environment tests, including functional tests, unit and component tests, performance and load tests, usability and user acceptance tests and exploratory tests
• coordinate and lead the delivery of quality assurance and continuous improvement (QA, CI) services for the Cluster, and its partners


Please note: The current location for this position is in Toronto, however, Oshawa may be considered as an alternate location for part of the work week based on operational requirements and upon the successful applicant's request as per the Central Agencies Cluster's flex program.


Location: Toronto


How do I qualify?


Quality Assurance and Testing Knowledge and Skills



  • you have knowledge and understanding of quality assurance methodologies, object-oriented analysis/design techniques, proven facility in structured methodologies for the design, development/implementation of n-tier web-based applications, extensive experience in the use of test and development tools
    • you have excellent working knowledge of industry best practice testing automation tools including tools for use in LAMP/open source environments
    • you have knowledge of current development and testing tools/languages within the different frameworks and platforms (especially Java, LAMP) and the development/testing of collaborative workspaces and portals using industry standard technologies


Knowledge



  • you have proven experience in the development/testing/implementation of applications, including considerable knowledge of different platforms, operating systems, environments, database technologies, languages and telecommunications protocols
    • you have knowledge of and experience with testing best practices in the context of agile development methodologies
    • you can estimate significant development/implementation costs as they relate to quality control components and develop and interpret technical standards and guidelines


Leadership and Analytical Skills



  • you can lead test planning activities and projects
    • you have proven experience in monitoring/enforcing application development and quality control standards


Communication Skills



  • you have demonstrated customer service and consensus building skills to determine client expectations for the development/ implementation of information systems and technology that meet corporate efficiency, effectiveness, access and security goals
    • you can provide credible/timely advice to the Senior Manager and project managers, lead quality control activities, undertake quality control reviews, report on findings, and recommend solutions to improve software quality


Salary Range: $1,357.77 - $1,753.98 per week



Additional information:



  • 1 Permanent, 222 Jarvis St, Toronto, Toronto Region



Please apply online, only, by Friday, July 22, 2016, by visiting www.ontario.ca/careers and entering Job ID 95399 in the Job ID search field. Please follow the instructions to submit your application. Faxes are not being accepted at this time.


If you require accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us at www.gojobs.gov.on.ca/ContactUs.aspx to provide your contact information. Recruitment Services staff will contact you within 48 hours. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.


The Ontario Public Service is an inclusive employer. Accommodation will be provided in accordance with Ontario’s Human Rights Code.


 www.ontario.ca/careers

jobs.title: User Experience Strategist
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: http://alleyinteractive.applytojob.com/apply/q7gtS2/User-Experience-Strategist?source=wwr

Alley Interactive is a team of experienced web developers, designers, and UX professionals who tackle the most complex challenges facing top publishers. We design and build big websites using open source technologies for leaders in media, entertainment, and nonprofit publishing. We are seeking an experienced IA/UX professional who loves the process of project discovery, requirements documentation, and information architecture creation.

At Alley, we conduct our work within an agile framework; design, development, and UX work lockstep through sprints ensuring our projects succeed, and that we work as an efficient, tightly integrated team. We aim to change the fundamental way sites are built—rather than working with static designs in Photoshop, we execute the visual design process in the browser using front-end technology.

To ensure front-end and back-end development unfold smoothly, we begin our projects with an agile discovery phase where we convert project requirements, business goals, and audience needs into user personas, stories and information architecture. From there, we work in sprints and actively collaborate across disciplines to create sketches and prototypes that guide development. The UX Strategist’s primary role will be executing this initial work, collaborating with UX Designers and developers as they craft our clients’ websites.

Responsibilities
  • Identify client business goals, audiences, and success metrics that collectively inform UX design and development solutions.
  • Author user personas.
  • Develop new information architecture (sitemaps, content types, and taxonomies).
  • Participate in user story writing workshops and design studios.
  • Participate in Quality Assurance (QA) on prototypes and websites prior to launch.
  • Work with clients to make iterative improvements to their sites after launch.
  • Work closely with Alley’s Director of User Experience, Creative Director, UX Designers and UX Developers.

Qualifications
  • Demonstrable experience as an IA/UX professional.
  • Ability to manage and keep track of project requirements.
  • Experience developing information architecture, user flows, user personas and stories, and wireframes, both sketches and high fidelity.
  • Familiarity with the website design and development processes, ideally with experience in Agile environments.
  • Ability to work in a team-based, remote, agency environment.

About Alley Interactive
We offer competitive salaries and company subsidized medical, dental and vision benefits. We also offer a 401(k) with company matching, a profit sharing plan, and transportation and lunch benefits programs.

We have no set hours and do not limit vacation or sick time (but we require everyone to take a minimum of two weeks off). We trust our team members to get their work done and take the time off they need to recharge.

Alley was born in New York City, and we have an office in the Flatiron District of Manhattan. We also have an office in downtown Burlington, Vermont. Our team members are free to work at either of these locations, or out of their homes or a local coworking space. About a third of our team lives in the New York area, and the rest are spread around 19 other states (and counting).

Alley Interactive is an equal opportunity employer and we seek to increase diversity in the tech industry. We encourage applications from women, people of color, people with disabilities, members of the LGBTQ community, and other communities traditionally underrepresented in this field.

To apply: Follow this link (https://alleyinteractive.applytojob.com/apply/q7gtS2/User-Experience-Strategist?source=wwr) and please complete the application, being sure to send your resume and your portfolio. Recruiters: Please do NOT contact us about this job. All hiring duties at Alley are carried out by our staff.

jobs.title: Work From Home Salary+Commission Part-Time Spanish, French, German, or Portuguese Speaking Inside Sales Representative for BrickFTP
jobs.content:
Do you absolutely love sales and get excited about the idea of scoring your next commission? 

Enjoy learning about and working with software-as-a-service?

Want to boost your income without changing your lifestyle?

Do you speak at least one of the following languages:  Spanish, French, German, or Portuguese?

Does making $1,000 a month + 5% commissions for just 10 hours a week sound good? 

 

If so, we have an awesome, part-time career opportunity at a fun, laid-back tech company.

We're Action Verb, and we're looking to hire a part-time inside sales professional to join our team.  You'll be the front line inside sales representative for BrickFTP (http://brickftp.com/) for your language (Spanish, French, German, or Portuguese).

This is a part-time, salary + commission, work-from-home position.  

BrickFTP is expanding into foreign markets with a focus on Brazil,  Spanish-speaking South America,  France, and Germany.  We are looking for bilingual speakers who speak their market's language as well as full fluency in English.  

For French and Germany, we prefer folks physically located in Europe, or at least willing to work European timezone hours.  For Spanish or Portuguese, we are open to staff in the United States or anywhere in the Americas.

If you can cover more than one language (besides English), we especially want to talk to you.

Pay is on a contract basis, unless you are from the United States, in which case, you could instead be a W2 employee.

This could be a great add-on to anyone who is currently working from home and wants another opportunity to round out their portfolio of work.

Recruiters, please stop reading now.  We only want to talk directly to interested candidates.


Action Verb's Story

Action Verb is a bootstrapped, profitable company founded in 2007.  Action Verb offers two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated SaaS CMS system.  Our SaaS services have over 1,600 paying customers and a total userbase of about 50,000 users.

We're a small company (you'll be the 6th, 7th, or 8th person on the team when you join). We all work from home and communicate via Slack.

You can check out our website at https://brickftp.com/.

 

Here's where you come in.

Although this is a sales position, it is not one of those hard-selling, cold-calling types of stressful sales jobs.

You'll be calling and emailing warm leads who have responded to online advertising and would like to be walked through our software products before deciding to buy. Your job is simply to help them understand our software, how it can benefit them, and why they should use our software instead of our competitors.

Basically, you'll be the "face" of our business to all our prospects in your market.

You'll patiently deal with users who don't fully understand our products.  However, most of our customers are highly technical CTOs or IT director-types, so we hope that your time will be spent mostly with high-level customers who understand our products.

You'll have the support of our 4 staff engineers in case the sales calls get too technical.

BrickFTP is an easy product to sell.  Our customers are businesses and the price point is just $49 per month, so this is not a high-pressure sales situation.  Also remember that these are warm leads who opted-in asking for a phone call.

You will also be responsible for front-line customer support in your language/market.  Any issue you can resolve yourself, you'll resolve, and anything else you'll work with our English-speaking support engineers to resolve.  You may have to get on conference calls to translate for our customers if necessary.

 

Here are the details of the Pay.

Pay is $25 per hour for 10 hours per week plus 5% of the annual value of any package that you sell.  We expect the average commission to be about $50.

Each market receives an average of 200 leads per month, and we expect that a good sales person will be able to convert them at 10-20%.

What skills are we looking for?

We are looking for you to have:

  • Perfect phone demeanor and ability to communicate effectively via the phone.
  • Perfect grammar and professional tone via email.
  • Basic understanding of the technical aspects of hosting.
  • Fluency in English plus the language of at least one foreign market:  Brazil, Spanish-speaking South America, France, or Germany.  If you can speak more than one language, please say so!
  • Previous experience doing telephone-based inside sales, ideally in a software or technology related business.
 

What makes this opportunity unique?

A really awesome team.  The team includes a strong technical founder and four other top technical engineers and operations folks.  We'll have your back and do everything in our power to make your job as easy as possible.

Work from home.  Thereâs nothing we hate more than commuting.  So, we donât have an office and would definitely like to avoid having one for as long as possible.  If you have a family at home, move between locations, or even live abroad, this is a great opportunity to do all your work from home and stop wasting all that time on commuting.   Itâs like getting 2 free hours added back to your day.

Choose your own hours. As long as youâre available to take calls and return calls during the business hours of your market, we're flexible with exactly when you work during the day.  Work 2 hours, then run and take the kids to lunch, come back and work another 3 hours.  We work highly variable hours so weâll be able to sync up no matter when you work.  We do have full team meetings on Tuesdays and Wednesdays at 4pm Eastern, so those are required as well.

Free travel.  Because weâre a distributed team that all work from home, we go out of our way bring the team together in person a couple times a year.  We speak at a number of industry conferences (think PubCon, AdTech, Affiliate Summit, etc.) and at various Internet Marketing meetups, summits, and training sessions.  When it makes sense, and when we can, weâd like to bring you along.

We use these as an opportunity to get the team together to relax, work, brainstorm, and party with our customers and each other.

Some of these trips will be in conjunction with the programming and marketing teams from our other companies, so youâll get to meet the âextended familyâ as well.

Stability.  Action Verb is bootstrapped, profitable, adequately capitalized, and debt-free.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience and believe that our products will never be âfinished.â

To apply: Submit Your Resume Here: http://actionverb.jazz.co/apply/jYnAuF/Work-From-Home-SalaryCommission-PartTime-Spanish-French-German-Or-Portuguese-Speaking-Inside-Sales-Representative-For-BrickFTPWe can't wait to read it and we're looking to hire immediately. Thanks for reading!

jobs.title: Java Development Lead
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
Role Mandate:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the Director, Software Development and will assist in building, improving, and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel eCommerce platform. This is a hands-on technical role, leading and mentoring a team of both senior and junior developers within the eCommerce Team. You will also lead by example, developing software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to server-side Java.

Responsibilities:

• Manage the day-to-day activities of the Development Team
• Ensure long-term direction of the project from a technical perspective
• Motivate, coach, and train team members in a manner that will exceed business’ expectations
• Provide clear directions and guidance on technical issues to all team members
• Write high-quality code for web-based applications, to create and improve robust high-volume production applications
• Develop and evaluate prototypes and ideas quickly
• Take the lead in code and architecture reviews
• Lead the effort to create and refine a modern, efficient front-end using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML using the Spring framework
• Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into final products
• Develop JavaScript solutions using standard frameworks including JQuery
• Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse
• Assist in acceptance testing for business and technical requirements
• Improve program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance
• Work closely with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables
• Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.
• Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.


Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

We are an agile shop, constantly tinkering with our process to make all our lives better. That process includes JIRA Agile for end-to-end agile project management and defects, Bamboo for CI, Git (Stash) for source control, Selenium for automated testing, JRebel and 15" Retina MacBookPro's for all our developers.

The Role:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the E-Commerce Technology Lead and will assist in building, improving and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel e-commerce platform. This is a hands-on role in the E-Commerce Development Team where you will develop software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS & Javascript to server-side Java and application specific database tuning on Oracle.

As a senior software developer at Loblaw Digital, you will be presented with opportunities to:

• Develop complex consumer facing software using Java, Spring Framework and Hybris.
• Mentor, coach less experienced developers, through design sessions, code reviews and pair programming.
• Work through hard problems with your team and deliver consistent results.
• Think long term. Create technical roadmap for products or services your team owns.
• With your experience and judgment, influence the business on how software can enhance end user experience.
• Follow agile development principles when the situation calls for it. Use tools such as continuous integration, automated tests and automated deployments to improve product time-to-market.
• Work together with front-end developers and external development agencies.
• Organize and participate in our twice a year hackathons, where technology and business work together to create cool things.

jobs.title: Director of Service Delivery REMOTE
jobs.content:
About XWP


Companies with complex, large-scale WordPress platforms partner with XWP for technical consulting and engineering. We have a passion and enthusiasm for what we do and a sincere care for each other and our clients. XWP is a place where people find challenging work, collaborative teammates, and opportunities to grow and serve. We work remotely and are distributed globally.


This is an invitation for the right person to join our team and craft a new vision for what exceptional service delivery can be at XWP and lead our team in achieving that vision.


Your invitation awaits if you…



  • Are seasoned in the strategy, planning, execution and delivery of large-scale software development projects with distributed teams using agile methodologies

  • Have proven skills guiding and mentoring project managers and technical leads

  • Want to play a key part in helping our company and team explore and expand its potential

  • Believe in building positive, trusting relationships and in serving others before yourself

  • Want to be surrounded by a team who champions your work, supports your decisions, celebrates your successes and challenges you to expand your thinking

  • Desire to serve in a purpose-filled role where you will make a meaningful difference


You should apply if you get excited about the opportunity to....



  • Consistently push the bar for how we serve our clients during delivery

  • Develop people, processes, and tools that serve in delivery of services and products to our clients

  • Champion the design and implementation of our delivery methodologies and tools for teams

  • Support our Team Leads in delivering what we’ve promised and in creating exceptional experiences for our clients


The impact you will have...



  • With your guidance our Team Leads will learn and grow in their roles

  • In your care our client’s satisfaction will consistently be high and improve across the board, helping boost the view of XWP as trusted and peerless advisor

  • Through your stewardship the quality of our internal delivery processes will be improved and consistently be evaluated and iterated

  • Under your leadership our financial performance on client projects will be strong


You will enjoy…



  • Trust and support from your colleagues (we look out for each other and work together towards our shared goals and vision)

  • Rewards of a highly collaborative culture

  • Joys of remote work: schedule flexibility, skip the commute, more time for family and interests outside of work

  • The chance to play a part in helping XWP grow its potential and make a meaningful difference for our clients, team members and the WordPress community


Does this excite you?  


Apply and tell us how this is a perfect fit for you and why you may be the one we’re looking for!


And if this role is not for you, please share it with anyone you know who might be interested in the opportunity.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for talented software engineers to define and build our next-generation cloud infrastructure management products. If you thrive in a high-velocity agile environment where your contributions are rapidly deployed to real customers, then Webscale is your kind of place.

Will collaborate with other members of the engineering team to implement features, create automated tests, and perform peer reviews. Applies diagnostic skills to support and maintain existing features in multiple deployments.

jobs.title: Sr. Python/Django Engineer

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer, Bitbucket
jobs.content:
Are you a creative and talented front-end developer? Are you passionate about working on a dynamic team that ships code to millions of users several times a week? Want to build the future of code collaboration at a company built by developers for developers?


Come join us at Atlassian and work on Bitbucket, our source code collaboration and hosting site. You will be working in a fast-paced SaaS environment where every line of code you write will be appreciated by a developer community of millions. You'll be responsible for implementing, monitoring, and optimizing the code that powers Bitbucket's UI. The company and our products are scaling rapidly and this is the team with the most to gain.


On our team, you'll have the opportunity to:



  • Dream up and develop new features for Bitbucket that will make millions of developers around the world more productive

  • Work across cutting edge frameworks and technologies, like React, Redux, and JavaScript ES6

  • Keep Bitbucket's front-end lean and fast

  • Ensure all features are a pleasure to use

  • Keep us honest and teach us a thing or two about writing clean, maintainable front-end code


More about you



  • You have the ability to write any component in vanilla JavaScript, but the intelligence to leverage existing libraries when it makes sense



  • We're exploring use of React and Redux, and we write all new code with ES6 features, so familiarity with some or all of these is helpful



  • Efficient, well-structured use of HTML tags and CSS selectors/properties



  • We also use LESS, so experience with a CSS pre-processor is helpful



  • Highly motivated person who can deliver high-quality code in a timely manner, whether working alone or in a small team



  • Comfort with and understanding of DVCS; we use Git and Mercurial for daily development and run a website built around those technologies



  • Our backend is written largely in Python, and willingness to occasionally dive in on the backend to help fix small bugs or push features forward is always appreciated


More about our team


Imagine working in a place where you get to do what you love every single day. We are a ten-year young software development company revolutionizing the way software is sold and used by businesses worldwide. With a range of innovative software products, we have customers globally including NASA, Sony, the Apache Foundation and the United Nations. We are building a different kind of software company -- one that listens to client needs, values innovation and solves customer problems with brilliant simplicity.


More about the perks


Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some killer perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, plenty of food and drinks (including beer and bubbly), ergonomic workstations with Aeron chairs, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years, generous employer-paid insurance coverage for you and your family, 401k matching and more.


More about Atlassian


Software is changing the world, and we’re at the center of it all. With more than 50,000 global customers (including 85 of the Fortune 100) and a highly disruptive business model, we’re advancing the art of team collaboration with products like JIRA, Confluence and HipChat–and we’re just getting started. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we’re out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment.


Atlassian. Powered by you.


We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior SQL Data Engineer
jobs.content:
What You’ll Do

Help us build the most robust health data pipeline ever! If you don’t want to be a cog in a machine, you’ll love it here. We need your help in a lot of places:

  • Translating incoming data layouts into clean database tables
  • Working with implementation managers to ensure that the metrics our customers want to analyze are fast
  • Translating classification and summarization logic from our clinical teams into efficient SQL or Python
  • Tuning slow queries to get them up to speed
  • Writing data quality tests and summaries to run as part of our data pipeline
  • We like to work with people who enjoy owning projects and both the responsibility and the autonomy that comes with that.

Please Have Experience With Things Like...

  • SQL
  • MySQL
  • Data warehousing
  • AWS

Bonus Points for Experience With...

  • Healthcare data (especially claims and eligibility)
  • Python
  • Postgres
  • Building web-based enterprise software

About Us

Healthcare in America is broken — help us fix it! In 2014 self-insured employers paid $620B for healthcare and 30% of that was waste. At Artemis we’re building a platform that identifies waste and low-quality care, suggests solutions to reduce both, and tracks whether or not these solutions actually work. We’re doing it by bringing the latest technology and design from outside healthcare to reimagine the way employers get value out of their data. By empowering employers to bend their own cost curve down, together we can bring America’s runaway healthcare costs more in line with the rest of the world.

Perks

  • Work with a world-class development team
  • All the snacks and drinks you want!
  • Frequent meals on the company
  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Health benefits
  • Competitive Salary and stock options
  • Work on what interests you most
  • A generous budget to get the dev rig of your choice
  • Relocation assistance available for outstanding candidates

- develop for our out-of-band execution environment which collects analytics and distributes posts across social channels.

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.content:
Why are we hiring a Project Manager?

Simple: Weâre growing.
Weâre growing, and weâre growing fast. Weâre searching for the best and the brightest project managers that San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Salt Lake City have to offer! Weâre searching for ambitious, driven, and creative game changers with a passion for revolutionizing digital marketing technologies. We want talented innovators, who never settle for the adequate, and always strive for greatness.
Why? Because thatâs who we are.
 
Who are we?
http://uptrending.com/
Location
We're currently looking to add exceptional talent to work out of our San Francisco, Santa Monica, and Salt Lake City offices, as well as remotely.

What makes an UpTrending Project Manager?
Reporting to the Director of Project Management, our PMs are responsible for managing client projects. Project Managers plan and schedule project goals, key milestones and deliverables, and serve as a support to our design, development, and marketing teams on our projects.  

PMs understand potential risks to projects that impact schedules, budgets, and resources, and can identify solutions to resolve these issues in a timely, cost effective, and professional manner. PMs host our weekly client meetings to ensure we are moving at a good pace, and that all of our priorities are in line with client expectations.

What we offer
As a part of our team, youâll have the opportunity to work on a variety of startup, entrepreneurial, and enterprise-grade projects â projects youâll be excited about. Youâll have the chance to work alongside industry leaders, and learn from their experience and expertise. Youâll have the opportunity to master new technologies, sharpen your current skills, and maximize your potential. We want our project managers to do more than just grow -- we want our team to thrive. We offer a competitive compensation plan, robust benefits, and paid vacation.

Technical chops:
The perfect candidate possess a deep understanding in the areas of web design, user experience and website and application development. Ideally, our PMs have the knowledge and understanding of front and back-end development best practices and terminologies.
What weâd like to see:

  • 3+ years in a project management role, preferably in a digital marketing agency or web agency environment
  • 3+ years of experience managing digital marketing projects (website, SEM, mobile, application, etc.)
  • Ability to work with remote resources and teams
  • Must be a great problem solver and have an agile approach to complex solutions
  • Experience with managing priorities and projects
  • Proven leadership skills and responsibility for cross-functional teams
  • Experience with Content Management Systems
  • Experience using Project Management Software
 What will set you apart:
  • Basic understanding of HTML/CSS
  • Experience using Basecamp
  • Experience in Wordpress and/or Ruby on Rails
  • Experience using Harvest
  • Experience using Photoshop
  • Experience using Git/Github
  • Experience using Google Apps
 What the day to day looks like:
  • Manages a complex project, or multiple projects, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, on schedule and within project scope.
  • Creates project plans and maintains the schedule for the duration of the project.
  • Identifies resource needs and tracks/maintains resource plan.
  • Creates overall status reports and leads weekly status meetings with the team and clients
  • Identifies and monitors project risks, action items and issues.
  • Proactively communicates project status, issues and mitigations to management team.
  • Partners with client stakeholders to ensure overall project or program achieves business goals.
  • Works directly with developers and other team members to track progress, identify and resolve issues, and look for ways to accelerate the delivery of the project.
  • Follows, adapts and develops processes to gain efficiencies in the workflow.
 Professional Qualities
  • Builds strong working relationships both internally and externally
  • Identifies opportunities for improvement and makes constructive suggestions for change
  • Manages the process of innovative change effectively
  • Motivates team to work together efficiently
  • Mitigates team conflict and communication issues
  • Tracks lessons learned and shares findings with team members
  • Sets and manages customer (internal and/or external) expectations
  • Builds a knowledge base of our customerâs business, organization and objectives
 Digital agency experience required. 

To apply: Send us your cover letter, rÃ©sumÃ©, and CV to https://uptrending.recruiterbox.com. We look forward to hearing from A+ candidates! Thanks!- UpTrending

jobs.title: DevOps
jobs.content:
Reporting to: IT Manager


Start date: ASAP


Who are we looking for:


We are always looking for amazing talent! People who can contribute to our ever evolving IT efforts! Geotab is actively seeking a person who has studied some sort of IT related degree at a university level who can script, enjoys process re-engineering and loves to communicate and collaborate with others. The ideal person really loves technology, is passionate about problem solving, and is keen to join a leading edge technology firm  – if you feel like we have described you, then we would love to hear from you!



What are the details of this position:

As part of our Architecture Automation Team, this role emphasizes skills in implementing business-driven requirements, plans and designs into our enterprise infrastructure, including the evaluation and implementation of hardware and software products. The role should monitor the day to day performance of our infrastructure. Creates strategies and develop resolutions around complex problems and outage situations. Emphasis is on both the development and support of these resolutions.

Duties and Tasks of this Position:



  • Automation is in your blood, and thorough familiarity with Powershell, C#, Linux scripting - a critical survival skill

  • Your experience / enthusiasm helps you learn and adapt to new technologies and changing situations quickly

  • You bridge software development and systems management, and with strong communication skills, you’re not scared to roll your sleeves up and help debug a development issue in your favorite IDE

  • Experience building out and scaling in cloud environments is a must

  • Operations monitoring, rapid detection and response systems

  • System level tuning and debugging, in particular on cloud, virtual, or containerized environments (e.g., Hyper-V, VMWare, GCE, Azure, Docker)

  • Large scale log collection and analysis via Big Data tools

  • Exceptional problem solving and critical thinking skills

  • Speaking your mind, thriving in a cross-functional team with strong engineers

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us:

Healthx, headquartered in Indianapolis IN, is the healthcare industry's leading digital engagement platform for connecting payers, providers, consumers, employers and brokers. Founded in 1998, Healthx leverages its industry knowledge, influence, and relationships to deliver customized solutions to payers that are looking for differentiators in the healthcare space. Fueled by innovation, Healthx is one of the first healthcare technology companies to offer a cloud-based platform for member engagement and provider collaboration resulting in 16 million log-ins annually. Today, more than 150 healthcare payers across the United States rely on Healthx Solutions to drive greater ROI for their business. Healthx is powered by healthcare and technology experts that are passionate about member and provider engagement.

What we need:

A Polyglot Software Engineer who isn't afraid to dig through some legacy code to optimize for future development; a problem solver not afraid to make their case for using the right tool for the job, be it programming style or new tools, you can make a case for the better practice.

Outcomes:

  • Ability to develop features for cloud-based healthcare platform
  • Experience in integrating disparate applications and systems using web standards as well as custom interfaces
  • Ability in designing, building, tuning, and debugging scalable systems
  • Experience with Full-stack development: C#, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, XSLT and SQL Server
  • Ability with API Design and implementation
  • Experience in problem solving using Big Data tools and techniques

Requirements:

  • Web application development experience
  • A passion for writing software to solve complex problems
  • Self-starter and ability to work independently
  • Collaborate on product teams utilizing Agile development methodologies

Perks:

  • Flexible hours including periodic work-at-home opportunities.
  • The opportunity to join a team that Engineers dont leave once they join.
  • An excellent benefit package that includes medical, dental, vision, life, disability and 401k benefits as well as paid vacation and holidays.
  • Participation in Healthx Employee Bonus Plan

jobs.title: Analytic Programmer with Expertise in Pharmacy Claims
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Portland, ME
URL: https://www.rxante.com/careers/

Company Profile

RxAnte is a mission-driven healthcare improvement company that helps healthcare organizations and individuals make better use of prescription medicines. Our patent-pending analytics platform helps health plans, healthcare providers, and drug makers deliver more targeted, more effective, and more efficient medication adherence programs.  We are based in Portland, Maine but offer a flexible work environment with many of our employees working from home offices around the country.

Job Profile

As part of the Client Analytics team at RxAnte, you’ll be responsible for providing analytical and strategic support to multiple customers, both internal and external. Our primary data sources are administrative healthcare and pharmacy claims data, however; we also use our own proprietary data. When we need to answer difficult medical and pharmacy health care questions for our clients or make business decisions for ourselves, here’s what we'll need from you.
  • Tell us what data we need to answer the questions we have.
  • Tell us the questions we can answer with the data we have and recommend additional sources when appropriate.
  • Aggregate data from multiple sources to create unique datasets.
  • Analyze the data and present a concise summary of the results annotated with the appropriate caveats.
  • Create meaningful tables/charts/graphs that can be analyzed and discussed with internal teams and then presented to clients in an accessible way.
 
Here’s why we think you’ll enjoy working with us:
  • You’ll be intellectually challenged. The problems you’ll be given are hard, the answers are not straightforward, and the timelines are tight.
  • Your work will be both independent and collaborative, which means you’ll have resources and support to chart a path forward, and the freedom to identify the best way to get there.
  • You’ll work with people who enjoy what they do and are good at doing it.
  • You’ll make a meaningful impact on improving the health and wellness of millions of patients.
  • We'll measure you on your results rather than the number of hours you are putting in.

Qualifications
  • An advanced degree in epidemiology, health services research, health policy, public health, mathematics/statistics, or other relevant fields is preferred. But, if you dropped out of school because you’re a self-taught, creative, and diligent problem solver, that works too!
  • Experience and interest coding in SAS. This is a requirement, we have a very small team and need people to be able to hit the ground running.
  • A basic understanding of statistics—if you don’t know what it takes for something to be significant, this position isn’t for you.
  • Experience working with large datasets, preferably in healthcare.
  • Lastly, you must reside in the United States, and pass a substance abuse screening (this does not include drugs that are prescribed by a physician—those ones are fine and we won't be told if you are taking them).

To apply: Apply at our website: https://www.rxante.com/careers/

jobs.title: Sr. Ruby Software Developer
jobs.content:
PhishMe is seeking professional and experienced Rails developers to join its software engineering team.  Our product line is growing and constantly improving, so we need some really talented people who have worked well on Scrum teams and want to do so again to build truly world class software.

jobs.title: Lead Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Mic's Lead Data Engineer will own the way we collect, analyze, and query data across the company.  This person will work across a variety of teams to understand data needs, including but not limited to editorial analytics, sales, and product management.  This hire will up our game and help us to reason with data in all phases of developing a product - from setting requirements to implementation.


The Lead Data Engineer will also manage the development of our in-house data platform.  We collect and process over 300 million data points each month, using keen.io, AWS S3, AWS Redshift, AWS Lambda & MySql.  They will manage this process, and also manage relationships with external data visualization/reporting vendors.

jobs.title: Manager of Software Engineer to help build a new Cloud Platform!
jobs.content:
Summary of the role

As an experienced Director, you will use your leadership, expertise and ingenuity to empower high-caliber staff. You will provide vision and direction to the Architecture, Quality and Governance group. You will study technology trends, innovation, competitive functional advancement, and customer/market trends in order to determine proposed changes to existing products and/or technology stack. You will define technical and functional strategies and priorities to successfully execute the business plan. You will manage budget, forecasting and resource availability. You will encourage innovation, work at the edge of the technology in the cloud services (Kubernetes, Openshift, OpenStack), data storage (CouchBase, MongoDB, Hadoop...) and application security using agile methodologies.



Main responsibilities




  • Provide leadership and direction to R&D managers and professional staff                                                                            

  • Select, mentor, and empower high-caliber staff focused on teamwork and using agile methodologies                                                                  

  • Study technology trends, innovation, competitive functional advancement, and customer/market trends in order to determine proposed changes to existing products and/or technology stack                                                                        

  • Define technical and functional strategies and priorities to successfully execute the business plan

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Overview


As a member of the Computronix development team, you will work in a highly dynamic, fast changing and fluid work environment. You will contribute technical expertise to design, develop, implement or support Computronix software solutions.  


 The Senior Software Developer is part of a team of developers working toward a successful implementation of our web-based workflow management solutions.  This role requires advanced knowledge and skill in a variety of technologies, with a strong emphasis in Oracle relational databases.  Because our solutions are built on an Oracle database platform, Computronix strongly prefers developers who also have database management experience.  Ideal candidates will have the ability to work independently, as well as with a team of developers in a dynamic environment.


Check out our Culture video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWUHiQ3sY5k

jobs.title: Python Engineer
jobs.content:
Summary of the role


The mission of Amadeus’ Hotel IT team is to design and deliver high performance systems that can process tens of thousands of requests per second and return the highest level of accuracy in the fastest response time. Our SaaS platforms are designed to serve millions of users who are seeking information and reservations from tens of thousands of hotels offering millions of hotel rooms around the world. Utilizing our proven ability to build and deploy mission critical software for the global travel industry, we are creating the next generation of technology solutions for the hospitality industry including: reservations and distribution, high-volume data acquisition from heterogeneous sources, sophisticated search engines, payment processing, hotel operations, business intelligence, and revenue management. 


The Amadeus Hotel Platform is the heart of a hotel chain’s business.  It serves as the central point of pricing, configuration, and booking for every hotel in a chain.  The system maintains thousands of hotel configurations, millions of pricing rules, and hundreds of millions of hotel reservations at any given time.  Whenever any of this data is created or modified, the Amadeus Hotel Platform must synchronize with the rest of the hotel infrastructure.
The Data Integrity and Publication team is responsible for guaranteeing that the data in the Amadeus Hotel Platform is synchronized to the rest of the ecosystem with a very high level of reliability and transaction volume.  The team has complete responsibility from defining the APIs, to creation of the publication feeds, to managing the guarantee of delivery and production monitoring.  The system is able to publish thousands of individual events per second at peak.
The Python Engineer for Data Integrity and Publication the glue that holds the publication system together.  They are responsible for implementing the business logic that allows system to run at peak performance and stay in touch with the rest of the hotel ecosystem. 


We work in SCRUM, and are looking for smart, flexible thinkers who can understand the business of our customers as well as produce the code that powers our products.  We are interested in candidates that are looking to work in a highly collaborative environment with a team drawn from around the world.


Main Responsibilities
 


• Build web service oriented web applications to capture, analyze, publish and display data
• Create ETLs to feed the data warehouse 
• Create reporting services 


Requirements
 


Education: 


B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent experience.

Relevant work experience:


Demonstrated experience working with server to server solutions
7+ years experience as a Software Engineer
2+ years experience with Python
