jobs.title: Senior Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York City, NY
URL: http://tanookilabs.com

TL;DR - Great paying freelance and full-time work on amazing products.

This is not your average company job posting.

We are Tanooki Labs, a product and development studio based in New York City that works with entrepreneurs on early stage products.

We provide developers and product-minded people with fun projects to work on, as well as the flexibility and freedom to continue working on their own goals (be it recording an album, crafting your next app, or raising the newest member of your family).

We choose our clients and projects carefully, and every product we build requires us to tackle new and exciting challenges. We also reject the idea that software development has to feel like a grind. We work 35 hours a week, support flexible schedules, are family friendly, and work with both local and remote developers.

REQUIREMENTS

We are looking for pragmatic developers who build with:
  • empathy for users,
  • a deep understanding of the software we build and our clients' businesses,
  • an eye toward writing well architected code.

You should have:
  • a strong background in Ruby on Rails
  • experience developing applications from the ground up
  • experience with behavior-driven development and unit testing
  • a product-minded focus when creating applications
  • good communication skills in English and a location in North America

To apply: Please send a resume to jobs-rails@tanookilabs.com

jobs.title: Backend Architecture / CUDA / Computer Vision for Smart Geometry Platform
jobs.content:
Metamason is building an automated software platform that integrates 3D Scanning, Parametric Design, and 3D Printing to generate personalized products. We are a combination high-computing software company, product design firm, and next-wave manufacturer, headquartered in downtown Los Angeles, setting forth to make products that perfectly fit each user. Our flagship product, a patient-specific CPAP mask to treat obstructive sleep apnea, is set to launch this time next year, with more products coming soon thereafter.

On the tech front, we have several open positions to work on building this platform, which will take 3D scan data from a Structure.io scanner on an iPad and feed it into a smart geometry pipeline to parametrically generate a personalized model that perfectly fits the user's face, and then send that model to a medical-grade 3D printing facility. In terms of that smart geometry pipeline, we currently have a working prototype using Grasshopper 3D and need to transfer that functionality to code.

jobs.title: Senior Rails/Back-end Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a full time Sr Rails developer that loves challenging new projects. The Rails developer will be building and maintaining one of our newest products to be available. Your job will be working with other developers, building API's, and building the product features. Youll also have final responsibility for features that you build and add to the product, from inception/improvement all the way through to deployment and management, so the Linux Academy team will know exactly who to shower with praise when you score a big wins.


Why Linux Academy?

The Linux Academy is a 5 year old company and is still one of the fastest growing companies in the Dallas Ft Worth area. We train and build products that have been used by over 70,000 students and companies like Rackspace, mailchimp, Media Temple, and plenty more. You'll be joining a team where the opportunity to be extreamly impactful in a very short time is huge. We are a fast paced environment that loves to fail fast and fail often in order to build the best possible product and learning experience for our students. As a company our focus is always on the students who train and learn with the Linux Academy.


Benefits

  • Free drinks/snacks
  • 3k worth of technology for office setup
  • Paid training, paid conferences, and paid travel to any meet ups youd like to attend
  • Fantastic bonus opportunities

Our platform is largely built on web technologies, and our technology stack is wide-ranging. Our framework enables rapid development of ERP and line-of-business applications that run across a variety of environments and platforms.

jobs.title: Experienced Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
We're building a better way


We get it.


We don’t want to micro-manage your day. We know that you want to do great work.


We understand we have to get out of the way for that to happen.


Our mission is to become Europe’s leading open source agency


And we’re well on our way.


It’s not just technology that we think differently about, we're thinking about the future of work too. We’ve re-designed our company structure and how we work together.


This allows us to build permanent teams that have long term, direct relationships with clients who want the very best.


1. You know best


Permanent eight person teams: UX, design and development
Self-managing teams: decide how to deliver work themselves
Everyone presents their work to clients
Flat organisational structure: your team has a real voice in running the company


2. You learn faster


Paid conference tickets and travel
Unlimited training budget
Internal knowledge sharing events and mentoring
Public speaking support - grow your profile
Paid time to support your open source projects


3. You decide when and where to work


Set your own schedule and working hours
Work from home, our offices or wherever gets the best results
Central London hub at One Pancras Square
24 days paid holiday per year
Paid charity volunteer time off


4. You learn new technologies


Our current technology stack includes Drupal, Symfony, AngularJS, WordPress, React and Laravel.
We’re one of the largest code contributors to the Drupal project in Europe.
We also helped found DrupalCamp London.
Check out our global Drupal contribution ranking and our Drupal team.


Can you help us become a European leader in other open source technologies?


5. You will always have the best tools


MacBook Pro with the latest software
£500 per year personal budget for you to spend on hardware, software or accessories


6. You're based in Europe? So are some of us.


Paid interview travel
Paid travel to events, meetings and training
Same package applies wherever you are

jobs.title: Experienced Software Developer for Multi-Domain Consultancy
jobs.content:
We're growing a diverse team of curious, creative people who love helping client solve problems with software. We're looking for thoughtful makers who are passionate about development and have excellent people skills.


Atoms work on self-managed teams of 2-10 designers, developers, and testers—collaborating to make custom products for our clients, from the idea phase through launch and beyond.


As a developer at Atomic, most of your time will be spent writing tests and code. But you'll also participate in the entire lifecycle: Research, Design, & Planning, project management, technical documentation, meeting with the customer, user testing, etc.


Atomic teams are project-based, so you'll get to work with new people and tackle new challenges every 6-12 months.


On each team, one maker (a designer or developer) also acts as Team Lead, managing the budget and backlog and taking the lead on client communication. We expect all makers to eventually grow into this role.

jobs.title: Senior / Lead Full Stack Java Developer
jobs.content:
Our technology team is seeking innovative and creative talent to be part of our growing multi-skilled team based in Farnborough, Hampshire.


We require an experienced (10 years+ with enterprise applications) senior software engineer who will be a key member of a talented team. You will play an important role in all aspects of the SDLC and you'll apply a great tech stack to deliver real business value in an enterprise environment.


The development work we do is varied which keeps it exciting and interesting. You can expect to work in every aspect of the development lifecycle and on every part of the tech stack, whether its data modelling, systems architecture, UI development, integration with 3rd party applications, production bug fixing, as a team we do it all. Each team member has a "can do" attitude and will take on any challenge. This approach gives you the opportunity to contribute to the team while expanding your skill set into new areas.


Your key responsibilities will be the analysis, design and development of solutions for critical business functions, coach/mentor other team members, help grow a strong development team, ensure code quality and team efficiency.

jobs.title: Web Developer - PHP, Flexible Hours, Unlimited A/L, Relocation
jobs.content:
Web Developer - PHP, Flexible Hours, Unlimited A/L, Relocation


Camberley (Surrey, UK)


Work on challenging web development problems, and make the world a more seamless place.



  • From £35k to £45k salary

  • Flexible working hours

  • Unlimited annual leave

  • Relocation expenses


At Symless, we bring multiple devices together into one seamless experience. Our customers include Pixar, Disney, Google, Facebook and Amazon. We’re highly innovative small software company with 10 employees, started in 2012. As a founding team member, you’ll wear multiple hats, embrace ambiguity, and take charge leading complex projects. You’ll have the support of an experienced team who’ve built software reaching millions of people. This is exceptionally challenging work, but will be the most meaningful and rewarding of your career.


As a Web Developer at Symless, you’ll be responsible for bringing our product, Synergy, to our millions of users worldwide by implementing innovative new features to make our website more useful and engaging. Own and participate in all parts of the full software development cycle; from requirements analysis and software design, to implementation and maintenance.


Apply online: https://goo.gl/Nww2AD
Life at Symless: http://symless.com/careers/


Salary & Benefits



  • From £35k to £45k salary

  • Flexible working hours

  • Unlimited annual leave

  • Relocation expenses

  • Training and certification

  • Work with new technologies

  • Free beer and food

  • Wear jeans and play video games

  • Design your own custom computer

  • Attend tech conferences

  • Medical and dental insurance

  • Pension contributions

  • Book allowance

  • Gym membership


About the role


To thrive in this role, you will need a strong web development background and to feel comfortable working in a young, creative environment. You’ll be working with our existing PHP/Symfony and jQuery code to develop new features and fix bugs. As a progressive company, we are keen to develop with new technologies such as Node.js and AngularJS. The millions of Synergy users are a mix of Windows, Mac and Linux, so you’ll need to test with browsers on all operating systems, and you'll be using our Synergy product to do this.


This role will expand your experience on API integration, UX design, database design, business process and will give you a diverse range of software development experience while working with new technologies. To work with our team, you'll need to be intelligent and passionate.


About Symless


Life at Symless (#lifeatsymless) is all about making the world more seamless. We're obsessed with saving time for our customers by making life flow more naturally. When you visit the Symless office for your interview, you'll notice something, we have a startup culture. As a small software company with 10 employees, we have the atmosphere of a startup, mixed with the stability of an established company. It's like someone took a piece of Silicon Valley and landed it in Surrey. We have the customers to match, too: Pixar, Disney, Google, Facebook and pretty much every tech Fortune 500 on the planet, not to mention the millions of power users worldwide.


We aim to attract talent because of the work we do (not just because of the calibre of our customers and our perks). We are all passionate about our work, because as well as improving the stability and usefulness of our products, we develop new and innovative features to make our software more amazing to our users every day.

jobs.title: Applications and Web Developer

Collaborate with marketing and communications department as it relates to development of approved designs for the website, LMS, email communications, and other public facing assets

Works with IT Manager to ensure software development is considered and tested as part of disaster recovery plan


Other [5%]


Make recommendations for continuous process improvement
Performs other tasks as required


Education / experience


Required


High school graduation or equivalent
Post-secondary education or comparable certification program
3+ years of programming, database creation/maintenance, application and web page development
Programming experience with .NET (C# and VB), ASP.NET, Microsoft SQL Server (2008/2012)

Experience developing modern, interactive, responsive web and mobile front-ends


Highly desirable but not required


Programming experience with other front-end programming techniques Knockout, Angular, Bootstrap
Experience developing in a .Net CMS environment (Sitefinity)
Experience developing in an enterprise CRM/AMS (Aptify)
Experience managing Google Analytics
Experience with unit, functional, and integration testing

jobs.title: Linux Administrator
jobs.content:
To expand our headquarters in Düsseldorf, peakwork is looking for:


Linux Administrator (m/f),


Network Administrator (m/f)


WHAT YOU DO


In your new position you will be a member of our innovative Admin-Team and are responsible for the design and implementation of new infrastructures, ensuring they reach the highest levels of performance and reliability. You will be working with the latest technologies and be able to implement your own ideas. Your tasks will primarily involve:


Linux Administrator (m/f):



  • Ensuring the full operation of complex Linux environments

  • Installation, configuration and operation of web and application servers

  • Implementation and operation of databases (using MySQL and MongoDB)

  • Server automation and patch management

  • Work according to the latest security standards, such as PCI-DSS

  • Responsible for our PCI-DSS infrastructure

  • Enterprise & security monitoring


Network Administrator (m/f):



  • Administration and maintenance of the exsiting network environment

  • Design of new networks across locations

  • Further development of complex firewall systems (IPS, WAF, VPN)

  • Service of redundant data center network infrastructure

  • Working towards the latest security standards, such as PCI-DSS

  • Assisting in the implementation of IT-Projects with other team members

jobs.title: Hadoop Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
A Day in the Life of a Hadoop Big Data Engineer: 



This is an exciting opportunity to use your varied skills and to wear many hats while helping Meridian to build out its leading edge Hadoop and big data environment.  Our goal is to leverage modern and emerging platforms to house our data for the many reporting and analytics needs that we have.  In this role you will be at the forefront of building out the environment, inventing new processes, configuring and developing components where necessary, and being an all-around Hadoop generalist.   If you enjoy being asked to do a variety of things, then this role will fill that need. 



Responsibilities: 




  • Install and configure Hadoop components and related utilities

  • Develop processes for source data ingestion, transformation, and database loading

  • Develop processes for data quality monitoring

  • Develop processes to support “Data as a Service (DaaS)”

  • File system management, monitoring, support and maintenance for HDFS, KUDU, and HBASE

  • Create scalable and high-performance web services for data tracking

  • Assisting with data lake folder design

  • Recommending and establishing security policies and procedures for the Hadoop environment

  • Assisting in the development and implementation of various strategic initiatives.

  • Contribute to development of Architecture Policies, Standards and Governance for the Hadoop and Big Data environment

  • Research and development with promising leading edge big data technologies

  • Participating in data architecture design and review processes, including planning and monitoring efforts, reviewing deliverables, and communicating to management

  • Responding to change and engaging in multiple projects simultaneously

  • Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks

jobs.title: iOS and Android Developer - Voted Best Place to Work in 2015
jobs.content:
TicketBiscuit is looking to hire an iOS and Android developer with with at least 1 to 2 years of experience. If you take pride in writing elegant code, enjoy learning new technologies, and want to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry, then we want to talk to you.



  • Developing new features and new products

  • Maintaining the current core products (i.e. keeping the lights on)

  • Producing detailed specifications and test plans

  • Peer review of deliverables

  • Automating and improving internal processes

  • Be a valuable member of our team


TicketBiscuit provides a casual, flexible work environment unique to the Birmingham area.  We're a small, agile development team.

jobs.title: Django Engineer
jobs.content:
Heroic deeds


As an engineering hero you will participate in all phases of the software development cycle from product definition and design through implementation, documentation and training.


You will work collaboratively with other engineers and must be open to take on any technical tasks that contribute to the goals of the team and the company.


Heroic tasks & responsibilities



  • Continuously develop our intranet and workflow management system

  • Develop and improve our tools for business process automation and workflow optimization

  • Train employees on internal tools and systems

  • Develop superhero gadgets to supercharge our products

  • Be involved in technical decisions

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.company: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory
jobs.content:
Summary: The Combat System Development and Assessment Group of APL is seeking an individual to perform software development as part of a team utilizing Modeling and Simulation (M&S) to address complex Air and Missile Defense (AMD) real-world challenges.


The job:



  1. Software development and integration of real-time and/or event driven models representing current or future tactical system behavior. Tasks include software design, implementation, integration, and testing. 

  2. Research and consultation with Subject Matter Experts to identify software requirements. 

  3. Documentation and presentations of software designs/implementations and M&S results.

jobs.title: Linux System Administrator
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Can you spot safety issues at a glance? Can you think like a hacker to boost security? Do you think differently? Join our Data Center Operations team and help ensure the safety and stability of the world's largest hotel search as you maintain and protect our site's servers. We’re always considering what we can change in order to improve so we’re looking for an experienced, creative tech-head who can give us a fresh perspective. You will monitor and maintain our multi-data center infrastructure and monitor the workload of critical systems, deciding on what changes we will need to make to cope with future workload. You will identify and strengthen vulnerabilities and protect trivago from attack. Think logically to troubleshoot reasons for critical malfunctions and set up automated processes for monitoring, error detection and system setup. You’ll have to find the perfect balance of safety and accessibility so that our users have the best experience possible. We want someone who will question our current approaches to technical problems and who can make sure that we stay on the cutting edge of technology as we rapidly expand. If you feel you can help us move forward, step up and show us what you’ve got.



The ideal candidate:



  • Has at least 4 years’ networking experience in organisations with large networks – preferably in a web environment.

  • Holds a bachelor’s degree or has completed an apprenticeship in Computer Science or has equivalent experience.

  • Has hands-on experience working with and troubleshooting network-related issues using Linux or FreeBSD-based tools. For those unfamiliar with FreeBSD, although you will need to use it on a regular basis, we will provide training and only require that you are an avid learner.

  • Has advanced know-how of monitoring systems (Nagios/Icinga/Cacti) and Apache httpd web server.

  • Possesses an up-to-date knowledge of network-based attacks and their mitigation.

  • Has solid scripting skills.

  • Will speak up if they sense any problems and is fully able to communicate their thoughts, needs and intentions so that any potential misunderstandings are avoided.

  • Couples razor-sharp analytical abilities with a strong sense of responsibility, urgency, and drive.

  • Speaks English (our company language) fluently. German language skills would be a plus.

  • Can start as soon as possible.



Life at trivago:


trivago is an exciting hub of multicultural activity where nationalities from all around the world come to share their knowledge and work together on redefining the travelling experience for millions of people. We nurture all our talents and provide them with the support they need to develop professionally as well as personally. We encourage fanatic learning through regular code workshops, Hackathons and constant feedback as well as promoting quick decision making in keeping with our trial and error philosophy. Flexible working hours are in place to create a trusting environment where productivity is measured through goals rather than hours spent in the office. For our internationals, we help with relocation and provide language classes for those wanting to learn and practise their German.
Join us at trivago – a place where talented minds meet, crazy ideas are shared and innovation is born.



Important additional information:



  • Please note that non-EU citizens will require a university degree in order to receive a work permit.

  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: VP, Information Technology
jobs.content:
The Vice President, Information Technology will provide leadership to the technology organization This individual will partner with the CTO to delivery product that help the organization accomplish its strategic objectives. The VP of IT must understand the development process and how to deliver a SaaS based platform. They will hire, assign and manage computer specialists and other technical workers to implement projects. The essence of the role is hands on technology leadership.


Duties/responsibilities:


The VP of IT will be responsible for the Company’s development. The candidate will be responsible for delivering a high quality roadmap.



  • Maintain software development roadmap

  • Servant leader working with other members of the delivery team

  • Partner with the IT organization in identification of data and business systems in support of continued growth initiatives and for improved efficiencies and business decisions.

  • Coach and develop staff and provide timely performance management feedback.

  • Direct and manage IT plans, schedules, policies, and programs.

  • Evaluate risks and create appropriate response plans.

  • Evaluate existing and new and emerging technologies and collaborate with leadership and their staff to research, implement and maintain technology products.

jobs.title: Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Nine Connections is looking for a talented Backend Developer to join our team. 

We are looking for someone who is always interested in working with the newest technologies and who is curious to learn more about Artificial Intelligence. We are working on an innovative AI based product, would you like to help us build it and make it a success? 


You will be working on the integration of user-facing elements with server side logic. You will also be building reusable code and libraries for future use and working on optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability. Our project teams will see you as a valuable resource and contribution to successful implementations and customer satisfaction.

jobs.title: Sr. Full Stack C#/JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
You will be working in an Agile Scrum environment with the support of an assigned SCRUM Master, dedicated product management and a team of quality engineers to develop new applications, enhancements, and provide maintenance on the existing product.  We are building/enhancing commercial grade SaaS web applications that will service an industry leader in the Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) space.



  • Contribute to an Agile team that solves complex challenges and builds working software by participating in design and architecture discussions, and proposing and discussing solutions to systems and product changes that are directly related to the area of focus.

  • Write clean, simple, efficient, modular, maintainable, and well documented code that meets the requirements and the design of the solution.

  • Write Unit and Automation Tests

  • Mentor peers

  • Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection

  • Proactively find and fix software bugs. Offer your feedback on ways to improve product(s) features, workflow, design, security and coding patterns

jobs.title: We are not building a monolithic Enterprise Java app
jobs.content:
Sky Betting and Gaming is a pure online business with a mobile first ethos that brings the excitement of sports betting, casino games, poker and bingo to a rapidly growing number of customers in the leisure betting and gaming market. Close relationships with Sky Sports provide a unique opportunity to deliver a real Sky experience that makes us stand out in the online gaming sector.


We live up to our values: Multi-disciplined teams with local decision-making means you can work without boundaries, we are truly collaborative across the business. Process is kept to a minimum, examples are: no timesheets, project codes, product owners not project managers, no yearly performance review, so you can really focus on delivery. You will be recognised for your contribution and rewarded appropriately. You will be empowered to define your own development through our Tech Ninja fund. Our staff use this to go to conferences or buy additional equipment.



What do we expect from you?


We are expanding our in-house Java capability this year in Bet Tribe, and we are looking to hire top quality, enthusiastic engineers from relevant backgrounds to work in our lean squads.


Join one of the most exciting tech teams in Leeds as a Software Engineer working with the latest front and backend technologies on the Skybet.com sports betting platform. 


No previous experience in sports betting? No problem – we have many experts to learn from, and the technical excellence you’ll bring is what we value. Salary and benefits packages reflect the high standard in our tech teams, with excellent training and development opportunities for all engineers.


You will be self-motivated and willing to contribute to design at all levels, listening and learning from the talented people around you. We believe we have a strong culture and we want you to be a part of it.



Reporting to the Lead Software Engineer, you will:



  • Contribute enthusiastically to our continuous improvement of coding practices, application quality, and agile processes

  • Deliver first-class products, which are secure, well tested, performant, and help provide an engaging customer experience

  • Play a proactive part in owning the technical systems your team works with; taking responsibility for monitoring, measuring performance and addressing technical issues when required, not just in office hours (on-call allowance with this role)

jobs.title: Director Security Operations Center
jobs.content:
Director Security Operation Center


Position Overview


The Director Security Operations Center [SOC] has strong expertise in Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP), network security monitoring and incident response. The Director SOC will lead key MSSP program elements including the following areas Predictive monitoring, Threat and Vulnerability Management, Threat Hunting and Cyber Security Risk Assessments. This role will be responsible for security awareness and enforcement, accomplished by pulling together information from a variety of systems; and normalizing and correlating the information. The SOC provides real-time detection and reaction services for information security incidents within the company.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Perform in-depth network security analysis and work with the SOC analyst team conducting incident response, event analysis and threat intelligence for the corporate enterprise

  • Provide both strategic analysis and near real-time auditing, analyzing, investigating, reporting, remediation, coordinating and tracking of security-related activities for the corporate enterprise

  • Analyze data and prepare reports that document vulnerabilities from network based attacks and recommends actions to prevent, repair or mitigate these vulnerabilities

  • Provide technical mentoring to other team members

  • Establish and create standard operating procedures for a variety of computer network defense (CND) related tasks/positions within the team

  • Provide technical expertise on post event network security logs and trend analysis

  • Review security events that are detrimental to the overall security posture; analyze and detect sophisticated and nuanced attacks and discern false positives and provide results to management

  • Perform correlation of events from a variety of network, enterprise and host collection sensors

  • Coordinate and liaise with other departments within the company and external auditors with information regarding intrusion events, security incidents, and other threat indications and warnings information

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer - Catalog
jobs.content:
ShopStyle, the leading product search engine, is looking for an ambitious JavaBackend Engineer to join our team. ShopStyle attracts over 10 million monthly users.We're building the next generation of social shopping with the best quality contentand user experience in the market.At ShopStyle, our catalog sits at the heart of the business. A cloud-based distributedsystem orchestrates the collection, normalization, and indexing of 18M+ productsevery day from thousands of sources. The Catalog team is responsible for buildingand improving that system, as well as innovating new data normalization andenrichment techniques. We’re also responsible for making our catalog accessiblethrough numerous publication techniques.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead design and implementation of new data enrichment techniques
  • Lead design and implementation of new catalog publishing services (both feeds and APIs)
  • Help overhaul our existing infrastructure as we move to a microservices architecture
  • Mentor more junior members of the development team
  • Assist project/program/product managers, providing technical information to do project scoping and scheduling.
  • Assist the business development and other product development teams by answering questions about our catalog system’s capabilities and functions

Requirements:

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of core java programming experience
  • Excellent understanding of OOP design principles
  • Excellent understanding of backend web technologies
  • Experience with relational databases (schema design and advanced SQL queries)
  • Experience with NoSQL and document-oriented databases
  • Passion for keeping up with new technologies and industry trends

Nice to have:

  • Team-lead and/or mentoring experience
  • Experience with AWS
  • Experience with MongoDB, Spring, Scala, and Spark
  • Experience with Elasticsearch

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Do you love the web? Do you get excited about using leading tools and development practices to make software for a high-traffic website? Then we’d like to talk to you!

What we’re looking for:

Technical Expertise:

  • Deep understanding of HTTP, HTML, and current web development frameworks, patterns, and practices
  • Experience with high-volume web architecture at both a software and infrastructure level
  • Passion for software quality and experience with continuous integration and delivery practices
  • Experience with automated testing
  • Familiarity with common software design patterns
  • Ability to mentor junior developers and help them weigh tradeoffs in design decisions
  • Ideally a strong background or interest in C#, JavaScript, and .NET development

Software Development Methodology and Support

  • Takes ownership of software delivery and accountable for successful releases
  • Experience in Agile software development, strong desire to eliminate waste and deliver value
  • Comfortable partnering with business owners to collaborate on product specifications, direction, and design
  • Excellent written communication, able to provide clear technical specifications for business requirements
  • Support an on-call rotation for nighttime incidents a few weeks out of the year

Technical Required:

  • Expertise in the following required:
  • Microsoft SQL Server scripting
  • React JS
  • Sitecore
  • Microsoft .NET
  • JavaScripting
  • HTLM/CSS and other web design components
  • Experience in the following preferred:
  • Endeca technologies

Technical Preferred:

· Background in iOS and / or Android development · Any open-source contributions or projects we could check out · Experience with ASP.NET MVC, Web API · Understanding of REST architectural design principles · ORM and Dependency Injection framework experience

Education and/or Experience:

Years of experience 5 years of application development experience required Education: 4 year degree required; IT Course of Study preferred. Computer skills Preferred experience in appropriate development language (see Specialty section) Certifications, etc. Appropriate Certification Preferred (see Specialty section) RDBMS experience Typically 6+ years of database development experience (see Specialty section)

Sponsorship Note: Candidates must be legally authorized to work for any U.S. employer on a full-time basis. Sponsorship will be considered for this specific role.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
You will be working on the team that creates and expands the Peloton ecosystem on the web. You and your team will be working on the front lines to implement a complicated user experience that can be seamless for both Mobile and Web users. In our planned expansion, our website is an essential part of providing metadata to current and potential Peloton Riders. We are looking for engineers who are excited about developing complex, interactive websites that have very thoughtful UX/UI. Currently, the team is working on building out an A/B testing platform, re-working out e-commerce check out flow, and actually migrating some of our Codebase to React. In addition, you will:



  • Gain experience working with Open Source tools like Typescript, Sass, Jade and more.

  • Implement Peloton Cycle’s web experience leveraging our real time REST API

  • Work within an agile development environment with peer engineers on a daily basis to scope, develop and deliver a software experience that realizes the product strategy

  • Make unique software with a great team dedicated to disrupting a category.

jobs.title: Project manager  A/B testing on major media platforms
jobs.content:
eye square is looking for a Project manager to join our development team in Berlin-Kreuzberg. Working directly with leading media- and research companies you will be responsible for development management and feature releases of our media research platform.


Our media research platform enables A/B testing on Facebook, Youtube, Instagram, Amazon and several other major media platforms and websites. A/B testing on live websites and apps is enabled by a combination of server- and client-side techniques which allow an integration with popular media platforms outside of regular APIs. Working on our product, you will develop a firm understanding of how popular interactive media UIs are built. You will be challenged to find creative ways to integrate the eye square control library into the media, preserving the user-experience on the one hand, while enabling experimental test control and data collection on the other hand.


Our team is working on a broad range of programming challenges in client- and server side JavaScript, online video, mobile app development (Android, iOS), integration of media APIs, analytics and reporting, system architecture, performance optimization and scalability, which require constant learning and quick adoption of new technologies.

jobs.title: Sr. Dev Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
IDG is looking for a Sr. Dev Ops Engineer to join the engineering team in San Francisco!


IDG is a global media, data, and services company with one of its many offices located in the SOMA neighborhood of San Francisco. Excellent benefits including health (medical, dental, and vision), 401k, fitness reimbursement, pre-tax commuter program and fantastic time off allocations are available to all employees starting day one of employment.


Responsibilities:



  • Automate, configure , optimize and scale Linux server environments (over 120 systems) responsible for support the day-to-day operations of a terabyte size high-performance IDG’s Digital Media Groups website farm serving our web properties to include sites such as Macworld, PCWorld, TechHive, CIO, Javaworld, Greenbot, Computerworld, and IDG.tv to name a few.

  • Working with engineering to lead troubleshooting efforts and to find  ways to make our current applications more cost-efficient.

  • Ensuring that systems and network changes occur without adversely affecting the stability of the production environment.

  • Enabling rapid deployment of new product features with the necessary safeguards to maintain stability, high availability and performance.

  • Working with senior Technology Leaders (Operations, QA, Development) on the Ops project roadmap and completing all critical projects on time as planned.

  • Working collaboratively with Engineering and business stakeholders so that critical business needs are met.

  • Build and deploy the internal toolsets when necessary to optimize network, infrastructure, monitoring and deployment

jobs.title: WebGL Developer
jobs.content:
The Position

This position is for an experienced OpenGL/WebGL developer. You'll be working with a great team producing a world-class native app. If you're a contractor and expect to just throw some forms together and collect a check, you should keep looking. If you're excited by the prospect of making a real investment in mobile communication then we should talk.


The Product

This position is for a lead graphics developer on a new product using our patented technology to bring 21st century personalization to mobile communication. The app is still in the design phase. You won't be inheriting someone else's bad ideas, or forced into a bone-headed architecture. You can come up with your very own bone-headed architecture! :P

We are breaking text chat out of the little blue bubbles by using a combination of cutting edge GL and our patented handwriting system. We are VC funded, and eager to make this hire.


Company & Culture

Handwriting.io holds 2 patents for the capture and reproduction of digital handwriting, with 2 more pending. Our older product is an API for turning unicode text into handwriting.

What we have is an amazing team of devs from all sorts of backgrounds. The culture that holds us together is a true rarity among software shops. We value open discussion, heavy pushback, and management by objective rather than the never-ending ticket queue. You can leave your Scrum cert at home. Our CTO's take on engineering principles can be found here: https://medium.com/@treystout/engineering-principl...


Benefits


  • Cool problem space
  • Top of the line hardware (you want it, you got it)
  • Good chairs, big monitors, adjustable desks (standing optional)
  • Competitive Salaries
  • Stock Options
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance.
  • Unlimited vacation

jobs.title: Imaginative iOS Developer
jobs.content:
About You


You bring amazing Objective-C skills and/or Swift and have a passion for iOS best practices and design patterns.


You’re love working with iOS frameworks such as Core Data and Core Animation.


You understand and are familiar with offline storage, threading and performance tuning.


You have experience building or adding to a published, high quality native iOS application.


You enjoy collaborating with a team to define, design and ship new features.


You have a knack for fixing identifying and correcting bottlenecks and bugs.


You love creating qualitative code!

jobs.title: Take part in our residential sustainable energy revolution
jobs.content:
Experienced software developer for 3D Reconstruction


We are looking for multiple developers, with C++ experience, who are passionate about 3D reconstruction and strongly motivated to apply their skills towards solving exciting, challenging real-world problems. This is an opportunity to get deeply involved in hands-on, cutting edge development work on automated 3D model generation using consumer image or video input. Our candidate will have senior level programming skills and has state of the art understanding of point clouds as well as 3D surface segmentation, model fitting algorithms.


 A few examples of our systems currently in use are:



  • Automated Sustainable Energy Advice Shop: Enabling home owners to get personalized sustainable energy advice just by entering their zip code. The Shop generates a 3D model by using LIDAR data and other open data sources. Based on this 3D model and our housing database the advice on solar panels, wall insulation, heat- pumps and other measures is generated automatically.

  • Solar Remote Quote: an application used by solar panel installers to remotely measure tilted roofs in images, design a solar system and create a detailed quote in less than 5 minutes.

  • Wall insulation Remote Quote: An application used to generate automated wall insulation quotes, by auto recognition of windows and remote surface measurement.


We offer:



  • A lot of responsibility within our development team to make the difference by deploying your knowledge to make sustainable energy solutions available to the general public;

  • High pace, short development cycles, result driven;

  • Interesting imaging and computer vision challenges;

  • Flexibility and freedom of choice in the use of tooling and techniques;

  • Flexible working hours, or partially working from home;

  • An informal environment and motivated colleagues.

jobs.title: Big Data QA Engineer
jobs.content:
The Big Data QA Engineer will be responsible for writing and executing functional and performance tests on Hadoop / Spark jobs in a large and growing Big Data environment.


Typically the testing will be performed on scripts that represent a data processing 'pipeline' (ingest > transformations > output). The Big Data QA Engineer will use their testing experience and technical understanding of Hadoop/Spark to:



  • Build in appropriate 'safety nets' - e.g. data quality validation; exception handling; etc

  • Assess transformation logic - i.e. should we expect the script to achieve what the author intended?

  • Automate where appropriate - e.g. enabling automated scala/java tests and CI deployment in Jenkins

  • Assess scalability and performance constraints - e.g. appropriate use of partitioning; not executing expensive transformations at the driver, and so on.



At this time we are only progressing candidates who already have the right to work in the UK.


***No recruiters please - we will not respond***

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
This is a senior software engineering position in RentalBeast's technology team. The mission of the technology team is to do what is needed to help the company scale, while also adding new applications and capabilities. We are very much focused on finding the most suitable technologies and tools for our mission, and applying them in the optimal configurations to achieve our business goals.


Current projects include: rebuild of several core systems (including our consumer website); build out of completely new applications to support new business lines; evolution of all critical infrastructure; work on a number of targeted development projects ranging from API integrations to database enhancements to development of core algorithms. Our likes: massive scalability, mobile, cloud, agile, APIs and caffeine.


Our tech team is small, versatile and highly skilled: everyone is involved with, and critical to, projects that have major business impact. You will drive the development of projects and features that will get serious use in high value business situations. While our team members have primary responsibilities and expertise, we are looking for people who have the skill set to be able to work across most areas of the platform as well as manage the release process, the code repositories and hosting tasks. 


We assume that all team members are responsible for developing, supporting and evolving unit and automated tests, and for managing the code repository, the release process, and our cloud hosting environment.


The team is small and the company is growing fast… engineers will be able to grow their skill sets, responsibilities and positions.


Currently, we are looking for a mid-level to senior software engineer with significant design and implementation experience who is highly motivated, self-driven and will take on the following responsibilities:


Responsibilities:



  • Design and implementation of new features and capabilities based on functional/user requirements.

  • Interaction with partners' technical personnel to develop API and other interface specifications.

  • Support of the back-end server, database and presentation engine.

  • Basic engineering responsibilities including release engineering tasks and management of our source code and cloud hosting.

  • Contribute to the overall team in a simple, SCRUM based and rapid turn-around development environment.

jobs.title: DevOps
jobs.content:
We are looking for a motivated tech talent in Eastern-Europe, not only for programming but also to help build our solutions in operations.


As an organisation, we believe in making people better. Our people can count on personal coaching and room for growing their knowledge and skills. 


We strongly believe in working together as a TEAM (Together Everyone Achieves More).


You can count on a salary according to Eastern European standards.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineers to Tobii AB
jobs.content:
Tobii is the world leader in eye tracking – a technology that allows a computer to tell exactly where a person is looking. Eye tracking is used in a broad range of applications including market research and eye controlled computer interfaces. Headquartered in Stockholm Tobii covers the global market with offices in USA, China, Japan, Norway, UK and South Korea. If you want to work with meaningful products and solve interesting problems, we might be the right company for you!

Tobii R&D competences range from electrical design, mechanical design, cameras, optics, embedded development, algorithms and network communication, to desktop software development, video streaming, cloud service development and quality assurance.



We are expanding and we are now hiring to our QA teams!


As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will work with testing our hardware and desktop software products. You will be involved in testing entire systems and solutions covering several products in combination. You will:



  • Perform exploratory testing.

  • Analyze test needs and document test plans.

  • Write manual test cases and automate test cases.

  • Execute on test plans and write test reports.

  • Be part of one or in some cases several teams to quickly test and verify new functionality and provide your colleagues with fast feedback.

  • Together with our other QA engineers develop test strategies and test plans.

jobs.title: Software Developer Java
jobs.content:
Our Headquarters in Düsseldorf is looking for:


Software Developer Java (m/f) 


WHAT YOU DO


In your new position, you will be a part of our agile software development team and responsible for the design and implementation of innovation back-end applications for the tourism industry, which set standards for performance and reliability. You work with the latest technologies and bring your own ideas to the table.


Your tasks include:



  • Conception and development of database (e.g. mySQL) and BigData/NoSQL Applications in Java.

  • Use of Java Enterprise Methods with web services (SOAP/REST) and messaging (JMS)

  • XML-/CSV-/Binary data processing, that meet the highest standards of reliability and performance

  • Care and further development of existing software components

  • Close collaboration with other peakwork teams

  • Testing and TDD are a natural addition to your responsibilities

jobs.title: User Experience Designer Agile
jobs.content:
We're hiring a User Experience Designer to join our Digital Factory team.


Responsibilities:



  • You will greatly influence the design aesthetic of experiences that touch 20M+ users every day

  • You will understand our users, leveraging rigorous design research and usability principles as well as your intuitive design sense

  • You should meticulously consider user interactions and journeys and act as an advocate for the constant improvement of both

  • You will produce compelling visual designs to illustrate concepts iteratively and be able to provide detailed specifications for use by UI developers of all levels

  • You will act as design owner through conception, build and release of features large and small

  • You are able to synthesize research outcomes into viable product experiences

jobs.title: Solutions Designer
jobs.content:
Aviva is revolutionising insurance and we want you to be at the forefront of it.

You’ll be joining Aviva at a really exciting time. Come and be part of building great new innovative ways to engage with new and existing customers, on a portfolio of products that reach out to 17 million customers. It’s never been more important for us to hire fantastic people who will sit at the forefront of delivering our strategy.

Digital First is our strategy at Aviva and this provides many exciting opportunities for you to play a key role in a range of high profile, technology-enabled projects. You will have previous experience (or appropriate qualification) in application development or systems integration. With customer facing skills and a genuine passion for quality / professional delivery, you will be looking for your next challenge with a company that genuinely recognises and rewards its star performers.

We approach software delivery with an agile mind-set, focused on delivering small, value driven enhancements often. We achieve that with our scrum teams that include developers, testers, business analysts and solution designers to create brand new experiences, small changes to existing products as well as investing in maintaining our existing products to improve code quality against our core development principles.

We are looking for Solution Designers to work within our scrum teams to build, test, maintain, change and further evolve both existing and new products.  You will be curious about what modern technology can offer and will support your team in adoption of new tools and techniques.

You’ll be responsible for:



  • Development of End to End Solution Designs to meet business objectives.

  • Ensuring that solutions adhere to architectural, security and quality standards.

  • Production of solution design artefacts to support the needs of project delivery.

  • Acting as point of contact to ensure all parties (including internal and external technical / development teams) understand the solution design and the part that they need to play within it.

  • Identifying risks affecting solutions, including mitigating recommendations and support in managing those risks.

  • Playing your part in a team of experienced fellow Designers who will provide you with support and mentoring.


We’re particularly interested in:



  • End to end project experience

  • Practical experience of working in an agile delivery approach

  • Practical experience of software development

  • Experience of system design, preferably working across multiple systems and teams to draw together End to End technical solutions.

  • Strong interpersonal skills

  • A good knowledge of integration technologies including SOA

  • Proven ability to interpret business requirements and design solutions based on those requirements



Additional Information

Please note that this role can be based in either Perth or Norwich.
We offer a competitive salary and fantastic benefits, including excellent pension and bonus potential, as well as generous annual leave.


We’re here to free people from the fear of uncertainty. Our insurance, savings and investment products help some 31 million customers enjoy life today, knowing that tomorrow is covered. And we definitely know how to look after our own people. If you love doing a great job to improve things for customers, you’ll be at home here. Help us build a future to be proud of and get ready to fulfil your potential with Aviva. 

Digital is our future.  If you have the talent, the right skills, are inspired by innovation and cutting-edge technology, then we’d love you to join us.  Apply now!

jobs.title: We're evolving but we like our objects immutable
jobs.content:
Scala


Sky Betting & Gaming is a pure online business that brings the excitement of Sports Betting, Casino Games, Poker and Bingo to a rapidly growing number of customers in the leisure betting market. Sustained growth over the last few years have made us one of the largest online operators in the UK and a close relationship with Sky Sports provides a unique opportunity to deliver an "Easy, Exciting, Sky" experience to a growing customer base across the full range of online channels.


Currently UK focused regulatory approval has been obtained allowing the brand to be launched internationally and build on the excellent growth achieved so far.


We have multiple agile teams following the guild and tribes model creating rich web applications and forging ahead with the most rapidly changing online gaming experience. This isn't just some bookie's website - this is Sky Betting and Gaming.



Reporting to the Engineering Manager/Lead Software Engineer, you will deliver first-class software solutions, which are secure, unit tested, perform well, and help provide a great customer experience

jobs.title: Linux Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
WSM is an established industry-leading technical services and solutions integrator undergoing a rapid growth phase due to demand for our cloud adoption, migration, transformation, security and DevOps services.


We offer virtually unlimited career growth potential for talented and motivated developers, systems engineers and server administrators.


We thrive in a casual, open, friendly and collaborative environment. Our work is rewarded with very good pay and an awesome benefits plan including health, term life, short and long term disability, 401k with company match (yeah!), dental, vision and flexible PTO. This is a full-time, 40 hour/week position.


We're looking for a sharp, self-motivated and self-managed Linux Systems Engineer to meet a growing demand for Linux environment cloud and server migration projects. 


You'll help plan, architect, consult and execute on a wide range of workload, application and data migrations working both independently and as part of our Linux systems engineering team. 



  • Evaluate, estimate and perform proof-of-concept for server and cloud migration projects (all Linux-based)

  • Collaborate with team members as well as operate individually to execute all phases of complex migration projects

  • Gain an in-depth understanding of our customer's objectives and related system interactions through direct customer, partner and/or WSM business staff communications, meetings and project discovery sessions

  • Contribute to DevOps tool chain implementation, DR and/or security initiatives as a part of the overall server or cloud transformation & migration engagement, and maintenance for existing WSM customers and partners

jobs.title: Lead UI Developer
jobs.content:
The Position


Reporting to the Manager, Development, the Team Lead, UI leads a team that works closely with Product and Marketing to deliver enhance the FlightNetwork site or deliver new online travel shopping experiences.


As a team lead, you will support multiple initiatives directly and indirectly by writing code, mentoring developers and drafting and approving technical plans. You will have a team of 3-5 developers working directly for you in our Oakville office.


We are in the process of rebuilding our user experience with modern front end technology including React and Node.js.


Our goals are:



  • Create a leading customer experience that has great UX, support for mobile and international growth

  • We’re highly data driven and want to increase our ability to operate numerous content tests simultaneously and with greater ease.


We have an industry leading proprietary air booking engine and industry leading marketing tools such as Omniture, Adobe Test & Target, DFP, etc.


We need you to help bring everything together on our new web platform.


Working relationships (internal/external)



  • Product Leaders – internal team members , working with the Product team to develop ideas, concepts and solutions that help meet product roadmap objectives

  • Developers – working very closely with the global development and engineering teams responsible for the FlightNetwork platform to ensure technical solutions meet intended business outcomes

  • Leadership Team – working very closely with Product and other Technology Leaders effectively working across multiple projects and delivering to deadlines


Technology


We have built our web properties in a number of different front-end technologies. It is expected that you will be comfortable coding in at least one backend framework such as Node, Django / Flask, Perl Catalyst / Dancer, Scala Play, etc. and that you will be able to guide projects and teams to appropriate solutions.


We are highly ROI driven and rely on Omniture / Google Analytics, Adobe Test & Target, Google DFP, Splunk, Errorception, NewRelic, etc. to provide us with the data necessary to make decisions related to customer experience and change.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
InComm Agent Solutions represents the cutting-edge of payment processing, offering customers an innovative proprietary platform that allows consumers to make cash payments to an ever-expanding roster of service providers. Custom designed from the ground-up, the IAS platform can be run concurrently at multiple sites to give increased resilience and complete service reliability. Plus, each interface can be customized to meet the unique needs of any retailer or service partner. This architecture allows each agent to be implemented, operated, and managed separately from one another, while optimizing the processing capacities for each.



The IAS platform offers:



  • Next generation complete application and interface design

  • Exclusive web-based, fully-secure virtual payment system that connects to any broadband internet connection

  • Automated self-service kiosks that accept credit card, debit card, cash and check payments

  • Seamless integration with any billing platform



By simplifying your payment processing, we maximize your revenue by minimizing your headaches. For more information, please review: http://www.IASnet.com



Day-to-day responsibilities include but are not limited to:



  • Develop high quality, efficient and defect-free applications, tools and other modules in C#, .NET, Transact SQL and other applicable languages and tools. Modifying existing applications. Must have experience in WCF web services, SOA Architecture, MVC including supporting UI technologies such as JQuery. Has expertise in object oriented design concepts. Must possess the ability to work in a team environment preferably SCRUM team environments, have excellent communication skills and a cooperative, collaborative and positive attitude.

  • Must be detail oriented and submit source code with a minimum of errors. Respond quickly and effectively to correct defects reported by the quality assurance team in code you have authored and that of others. Develop and execute comprehensive unit tests.

  • Respond to production outages as your highest priority and quickly resolve those problems with a minimal disruption of business activities. These outages may occur after business hours on weekends. In rare cases, you will be called upon to assist in the resolution of outages

  • Actively participate in periodic source code reviews as a recipient and as a lead. Adhere to all communicated software development standards and practices.

  • Must be a self-starter and have the ability to learn new tools, concepts and computer languages through self-learning. Programming guidance will be given by other team members as required.

  • Regular and predictable attendance is an essential function of this position.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Python.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Software Developer (Maternity Leave Cover) - building high-value annotations across large cancer mutation datasets £31033 - £39140

We are seeking a skilled and experienced software developer to join our health informatics database, COSMIC (http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic).

COSMIC is one of the key databases in human cancer research and is growing rapidly in data content, scope and analytics. This role will challenge you with evolving and expanding our systems to enable this growth. Data is currently gathered from a variety of sources, from manual curation to structured repositories, and standardised into the COSMIC database before release via our analytic website. This genetic and genomic data is increasing in quantity and scope, its value is enhanced by analytic highlights, and these positions will improve the handling, annotation and meaningful presentation of this information.

You will have an interest in developing software across big biological datasets, ensuring throughput and quality. You may bring new perspectives on options for storage, pipelining and visualisation; we are always interested in new ways to improve workflow. You will possess a degree in Bioinformatics or Computer Science, and demonstrate competence in a modern programming language, within a Unix/Linux environment. Experience of relational databases will also be valuable. With good communication skills, you should be able to demonstrate your previous experience using informatics technologies.Essential Skills
  • BSc in a Computer Science discipline or Bioinformatics
  • Expertise across relational databases using SQL
  • Experience in software development using Perl or Python
  • Excellent data handling skills
  • Self-motivated, able to work independently and organise own workload


Ideal Skills
  • Bioinformatics knowledge and experience using genomic annotations
  • Postgraduate degree in Bioinformatics or related discipline
  • Good communication & presentation skills to engage externally & internally


Other information

Database, sql, perl, python, pipeline, software, informatics

The Sanger Institute is a charitably funded research centre focused on understanding the role of genetics in health and disease. We use state of the art large-scale genomic approaches to drive world-leading projects to uncover the basis of genetic and infectious disease. Our goal is to provide results that can be translated into diagnostics, treatments or therapies that reduce global health burdens.

The Institute is located near Cambridge, UK on the stunning Wellcome Genome Campus. This growing and dynamic site is the British hub of genomic science. It hosts the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI), Open Targets, a Biodata Innovation Centre and will soon host Genomics England Limited's 100,000 Genomes Sequencing Centre. The Campus is also home to the Wellcome Genome Campus Courses, Conferences and Public Engagement (CCPE) programme. The CCPE programme delivers training and engagement focussed around genomics, its applications, and implications. Its vision is to inspire a range of audiences both on the Campus and beyond it, and make the world of genomics open and accessible to all.

Our Benefits include: Defined Contribution Pension Scheme, Group Income Protection, Healthcare scheme, Childcare Vouchers, Workplace Nursery and 25 days Annual Leave, increasing by one day per year up to a maximum of 30, plus Bank Holidays. We also have a gym, two cafes, dining facilities, and a free campus bus service. Our thriving Sports and Social Club provides many opportunities to meet with people working across the campus.

Please include a covering letter and CV with your application.

Closing date for applications: 29th July 2016 however applications will be considered and reviewed on an on-going basis and therefore the post may be filled before the deadline.

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
SwiftKey is now proudly part of Microsoft.


The SwiftKey Android keyboard is our flagship product, bringing together all that we know about language inference into a single market-leading application. As a keyboard, it occupies a unique position, having to interact with every other app installed on a device, as well as the end user and the underlying OS. In turn, this means that it presents an unusually broad set of development challenges, running the gamut from providing a compelling UX at the front end, via interacting with our extensive set of cloud services and underlying inference engine, to dealing with the idiosyncrasies of different apps and the complexities of marshalling all the data that a user generates when they interact with the keyboard. All this, and it has to run in a small amount of memory, and quickly enough that the user doesn’t even notice we’re doing it.


If this sounds like the sort of challenge that interests you, we’re looking for engineers of all levels of experience to join our Android development team. Whether you are a new graduate who might have done their final year project in Android, someone with a couple of years of experience in writing mobile apps who’s looking to step up to the next level, or a veteran developer who wants to work on one of the Android world’s star applications, we’d like to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Falcon is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Customer Experience Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and HR personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.
We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously while striving for technical excellence.
We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.
We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of around 60. We are not small anymore, and still growing. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice that one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative!
Falcon’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Bower, Grunt, D3.json top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lightweight Java8 backend running on DropWizard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.
This job requires extensive Java programming language experience and also the knowledge of how modern Java is done. We favor lightweight frameworks like DropWizard, we value a good domain model (DDD), we think in single responsibility (micro)services, we prefer good refactoring skills, pragmatism and craftsmanship.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End / Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:

You'll collaborate with an elite team of passionate developers who, like you, believe that with the right technology the best education in the world can and should be provided to all of the hundreds of millions of students worldwide, not just to small privileged groups.


This is a remote position with team members telecommuting from all over the world, but you will be invited to participate in periodic company-paid team vacations (typically taking place in some resort in Europe) in which you can get to know your team members better, and have a great time.

jobs.title: Nodejs developer in market research
jobs.content:
eye square is looking for a full stack JavaScript developer to join our team in Berlin-Kreuzberg. You should have a strong understanding of JavaScript and at least 3 years of experience in developing backend systems.


Our media research platform enables A/B testing on Facebook, Youtube, Instagram, Amazon and several other major media platforms and websites. A/B testing on live websites and apps is enabled by a combination of server- and client-side techniques which allow an integration with popular media platforms outside of regular APIs. Working on our product, you will develop a firm understanding of how popular interactive media UIs are built. You will be challenged to find creative ways to integrate the eye square control library into the media, preserving the user-experience on the one hand, while enabling experimental test control and data collection on the other hand.


Our team is working on a broad range of programming challenges in client- and server side JavaScript, online video, mobile app development (Android, iOS), integration of media APIs, analytics and reporting, system architecture, performance optimization and scalability, which require constant learning and quick adoption of new technologies.
